title: Amazing !
txt: I researched every known dishwasher on the market and kept coming back to Bosch. I needed something quiet so I didn't have to turn my tv up in the next room or wait til my kids were awake to not risk waking them up. After installation I was eager to put a load on . I read all instructions and used recommended cleaner . Turned it on and waiting patiently . I immediately panicked and thought it was broken or malfunctioning . It wasn't making any noise !!! I re read the instructions and noticed it said if the red light was shining on the floor then it was on and working . Sure enough if I leaned my ear in super close , I could hear a tiny amount of noise ! Wow! That's quiet . My dishes came out cleaner than I ever imagined ! So happy I went with this model ! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazingly dishwasher
txt: Absolutely love this stylish thought out  dishwasher.  It is so extremely quiet.  It does an amazing job cleaning. The dish in placement order is perfect, and the extra top drawer comes in super handy.  I recommend this unit highly. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Massive upgrade from our old one!
txt: Works great! No longer dread opening the washer to see how dirty everything still is after a cycle. The auto air feature is great. Very happy with the purchase so far! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Problem with lower rack
txt: A little worried about loading lower rack which falls ofc track and hard to re-align / lift when full of dishes. Seems to wash ok so don’t want to pay for a service call. Also has a bend in side and funny smell after washing.

title: Best Dishwasher by Far
txt: Loved the design and quietness of the machine, we made and thoughtful design specially the three layers with the top layer where you can placed small and big items that don't fit into the side utensil tray. I'd strongly recommend the machine for those who want to update or looking for a new dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

We are very happy with our purchase and also really like the "3rd drawer" for silverware.  My wife and I definitely recommend! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

During the wash cycle, the machine is quiet, perform well.  I am sure I will buy Bosch dishwasher in future as needed. Only one suggestion for now , I hope Bosch design team consider to add smart functionality design. Therefore, users do not need to press too many buttons in order to make it run. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: We purchased this dishwasher after a warranty fiasco with a different brand name dishwasher.  I wish we would have purchased this Bosch dishwasher in the first place.  It is wonderful! Everything comes clean with a sparkly finish!  My daughter ( picture attached) especially loves it because she no longer has to do the dishes by hand!  Thank you Bosch for a great dishwasher!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love our Bosch dishwasher
txt:
We got a Bosch dishwasher because it was top rated in consumer reports and they offered a rebate for the installation.  It was a great decision.  The quality of the materials is exceptional.  Even the inside of the unit is stainless steel. It is very, very quiet and easy to use.  We really like the adjustable shelves and the flat top shelf that we can put spatulas and big spoons on for cleaning.  The cleaning is exceptional. I have used a white plastic coffee cup for years. (I know but, I have 5 of them.  They are thick and oversized.  I've had them for probably 15 or 20 years).  Anyway, they are white and even though I clean them they have stains on the plastic. Without doing anything different, other that getting the Bosch, the inside of the cups are clean. I didn't think it was possible.  
  The Bosch dishwasher is everything you would want in a dishwasher.  Quality made, adjustable shelves, very quite, works exceptionally and made in the USA. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing Dishwasher - you'll love this one!
txt: The Bosch 500 Series Dishwasher is amazing! Cleans all dishes, glasses, and utensils with amazing shine and is oh so quiet - you don't even know it's on! Thank goodness for the "floor light" as seen on the bottom right of this photo - it lets us know when it's on and running through cycles. We love the Auto Air feature, that pops the door open automatically at the end of they cycle to help drying. This dishwasher with the versatile third top rack helps us add so much more to this dishwasher, better than our former older Whirlpool model ever allowed us to. You won't be disappointed - sleek design, and amazing quality! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My favorite dishwasher
txt: Wow. Must be something in the water,  or in the machine.  I NEVER HAD A DISHWASHER DO SUCH A GREAT JOB MAKING MY OLD DISHES LOOK NEW AGAIN.  Love the red light that shines on the floor to show that its running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch is The Best!
txt: When it was time to replace our old dishwasher in my current home, I knew the only brand to look at was Bosch. I have had nothing but Bosch dishwashers for the last 20+ years! My dishes are always spotless and the appliance is silent. We have a great room which includes watching TV during a wash cycle and you don't even  know it's running!

txt: Rating provided by a verified purchaser

title: Thank you
txt: We like this dishwwasher. A lot of space inside, dishes always come clean. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher Ever!
txt: We've purchased dishwashers over the years and, no matter how good the reviews, we were always disappointed. This time, we thought perhaps it was a good time to look at a Bosch dishwasher, but we were concerned it would be out of our price range. We did our research and decided that the Bosch offered so much more for only slightly more than some competitors. The quality of materials, the features, how quiet it is & the cleaning of our dishes, glasses,  & silverware was 100% better than any of our previous brands! Now we tell anyone who's looking for a new dishwasher not to consider any brand other than Bosch! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Paint Problems
txt: This dishwasher is a significant upgrade from our old one. Dishes are really clean and dry and the dishwasher is very quiet. The only criticism I have is that it is making the paint in my tumblers, bottles and coffee cups come off. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We’ve only had this dishwasher for a month, but I am very pleased with it thus far. It is so QUI...
txt: We’ve only had this dishwasher for a month, but I am very pleased with it thus far. It is so QUIET! We replaced a GE appliance and the difference is amazing. I was worried about the dishes getting dry as this has no heating element but it does a great job. I know you can get less expensive dishwashers but you get what you pay for. I would recommend.

title: Clean and Quiet
txt: We absolutely LOVE this dishwasher,  we had it installed in our old house and used it for over a year before we sold the house. We missed how quiet it was, how clean our dishes were and most of all the utensil (third pullout tray).  So when our dishwasher started leaking in our new house we looked no further and immediately purchased the same Bosch brand. We love the new air dry feature and of course happy to have the red light on our floor (it's the only way to know the dishwasher is on) [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing dishwasher
txt: Love love love the third shelf, the amount of room for loading dishes and how wonderfully quiet the new dishwasher is!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet with great features
txt: I was confused initially by the controls and couldn't find instructions to help.  I did figure-out what I needed to know and have had no problems, since.  One feather we like very much is that it is super quiet.  Space utilization is very good.  We especially like the top rack used mainly for silverware.  Very convenient.  The wash is thorough and dishes are dry enough even though there is no heating element in the wash compartment.  We typically use it in the evening and dishes have all night to dry.  The red light on the floor as helpful.  When it's a steady red, we know it's still working, and when it's blinking, we know it's finished.  Lots of different control options.  We don't use most of them, but the ones we want are there.  Good quality washer.  And, the service and warranty features are excellent.  We would buy it again.

title: Flawless installation and operation
txt: We love this dishwasher! We have done a kitchen remodel and changed 5 appliances. This was the only one that went in without something going wrong. Installation was very professional and quick. The installers even corrected a previous contractor's work without complaint. It has been working flawlessly since. We love how it is so quiet that you can't tell if it is running unless you see the red light on the floor. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The good and the bad (mostly good)
txt:
After a couple of month's use, here's where I'm at with it:

Pros
- Quiet. This was a factor in my purchase.
- Red LED light projected onto floor. If it weren't for the red LED spot on the floor, I often would not know it's running. 
- Seems to clean OK in the lower and middle racks.
- The feature to pop-open the door after the cycle is complete is nice. It was a selling feature since I've heard that Bosch dishwashers do not dry very well. 
- Adjustable dish and glass support tines and features. So far I fold most of these out of the way, but I know they are there if needed.
- Center rack height can be adjusted to three different heights. 
- Top silverware rack has adjustable tines and outer sections, and can be removed to fit taller items in the middle rack.
- The soap dispenser fits the Kirkland-brand detergent packets.
- Easy to DIY install. The instructions are good.

Cons
- Does not dry as well as my prior 17 year old washer. I think the feature that pops the door open helps. I was under the impression that these dishwashers use heat for drying, but there is no visible heating element in the bottom. Conversely, the fact that there is no heating element in the bottom probably means that plastics can be washed on the bottom rack. The only issue I've had with plastic in the bottom rack is that the jets are so strong that the plastic storage container flipped over.
- Spacing of the dish support tines is awkward. The plate tines are so close together that only plates and thin items can be used there. Thin baking pans (1" deep sheet pans) do not fit. The tines in the space for larger items are not aligned on the left and right sides, even when the optional tines are folded down, meaning that you cannot fit quarter-sheet pans across some sections. At best I can get three to fit, spaced farther apart than necessary, yet not far enough to fit something else between.
- This model does not have the two-piece utensil basket. I think Bosch should include the two-piece utensil basket with all models (why inventory an extra item?), but especially with all models that have the flatware rack. I only ever need part of the utensil basket and the two-piece basket would allow me to reclaim some bottom-rack space for dishes.

Would I recommend this? Yes. However I suggest considering models with better drying, better tine arrangements, time-remaining display projected onto the floor, and the two-piece utensil basket.

title: Clean as a whistle
txt: My dishes have never,ever been cleaner ! I will always recommend Bosch dishwashers, definitely worth the money. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dry clean dishes everytime!
txt: I spent a lot of time researching dishwashers and Bosch clearly came out #1 for reliability.  I selected this 800 series dishwasher for the AutoAir drying option and my dishes dry better than they did with my old KitchenAid with a heat coil.  I do live in northern Nevada so I live in a dry climate so maybe the drying problems noted in reviews were written by people who live in rally humid climates.  I was going to replace the long silverware basket with a smaller one but found that all our utensils fit in the flexible 3rd rack.  By removing the silverware basket it freed up space for more dishes which was needed since these European designs don’t seem to accommodate as many dishes as American designs. It’s a big plus being able to put plastic anywhere in the dishwasher. I turn my very quiet 42dBA dishwasher on every night before I go to bed and wake up to clean dry dishes. Plus it’s a great looking appliance.  I highly recommend buying the SHPM65Z55N/01.

title: Quietly Tackles the Dirty Dishes
txt:
This is my first Bosch dishwasher.   I had several other brands in the past.   Wow, what a difference.  

First, I no longer have to "pre-wash" my dishes.   They go from the table right into the dishwasher.   I have yet to see any food that this dishwasher cannot handle.

Second, it is the quietest dishwasher I have ever owned.   If it did not have the red laser light projected on the floor, I would not know it was on.

Third, the rack adjustability, took a few minutes to figure out, but now it's so simple and easy to adjust the racks to tackle any size pan or dish.

Fourth, I did the install myself.   The directions were super easy to follow.  The dish washer comes with a standard plug, but you can also order a hard wiring kit if needed.  It took less than 45 minutes, start to finish.

I am glad I followed the other reviews and chose this Bosch Dishwasher.   I highly recommend it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Even happier with the 2nd one!
txt: We bought a Bosch dishwasher at our previous house several years ago, and when we moved into this house in 2014, I swore I'd get around to swapping out the old dishwasher with a new Bosch unit.  Finally got around to it last month and it's every bit as good as I remembered.  Super efficient, super quiet and does a great job. Very well-designed machine.  Well worth every penny! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher
txt: Best dishwasher I have ever owned! It is so quiet you really need to have that little light shining on the floor so that you know it is running. What impressed me the most was that it cleans peanut butter off of knives without any rinsing at all!  The only reason I gave it four and not five stars is that if you use the uppermost, third tray for utensils and spatulas and such, you are not able to put stemmed wine glasses in the upper tray as there was not enough clearance  regardless I love how you adjust the rack.  Certainly not a deal-breaker and we are very pleased with the machine

title: Perfect Buy!
txt: Remodeled the kitchen and bought a Bosch 500 dishwasher. Excellent choose!! It is so quiet that you can not tell it is even running. The dishes come out sparkling clean. Easy to load and to use the third rack is great. Bosch is the top brand I use in my kitchen. Excellent buy for the price. Well worth every dollar spent. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent Dishwasher!
txt: I have used it now for a month and it is beyond my expectations. Excellent design and quality but the one thing that makes it extra special for me is how incredibly QUITE it is.  Love it,  Miriam S. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My friends recommended this Bosch to me. I am so happy with it! Does a fantastic job and I can’...
txt: My friends recommended this Bosch to me. I am so happy with it! Does a fantastic job and I can’t believe how quiet it is!

title: So quiet!
txt: I love my new Bosch dishwasher! Dishes and glasses come out so sparkly clean and yet it's so quiet we don't even know it is running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: DW’s Review
txt: Quality product very quiet does a great job getting our dishes clean. I do believe this is one of the best dishwashing units on the market for the value. The one area that needs improvement in my opinion is the programming of the options on the dishwasher. Setting up the options needs to be more self intuitive right now I had to pull out the owners manual to fully understand how to program the options that I wanted to utilize for the dishwasher. I do believe once boss spends a little time and makes the option programming more self intuitive that this will be one of the top selling units in the industry. The feature we like most is the auto air the auto air option really does get the dishes dry as we typically like to see with some of the new energy efficiency rules that are in place we feel this option is a must and that's why I feel like what I do about the programming. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Fantastic Dishwasher
txt: This is simply the best dishwasher I've ever owned.  My dishes are sparkling and some items that I thought were permanently stained are now completely clean and like new.  I love the Auto Air option that opens the door when the cycle is complete.  And on top of all of that, it looks great in my kitchen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Mostly okay
txt: Works well.  Our only complaint is that the inset handle is just plastic and it can easily get scratched or nicked. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My life and time saver. Bosch 500 dishwasher
txt: Make very quite and perfect job. now my hands look like as woman's, beautiful and healthy

title: Exceedingly Satisfied
txt: When we bought our current house in 2011 the flipper installed a base model Whirlpool dishwasher that lacked everything. Decent rack space, decent rack alignment, the ability to clean dishes without a prewash, the ability to wash itself, or the ability to properly hold half my dishware was lacking.  Also, when it ran we might as well have lived by the airport.  I finally gave up and washed most of my dishes by hand.  I researched dishwashers and settled on Bosch and got this particular model and am amazed.  The racks, the configurability, the efficiency blew me away, and we now have to go into the kitchen if we can't remember if we turned on the dishwasher because it is so quiet.  Anyone trying to take it away will have to pry it from my cold, dead hands. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher 500 Series
txt: The Bosch Dishwasher 500 Series is an outstanding dishwasher, and unbelievably quiet.  It features a third rack for large cooking utensils.  The interior design is great for optimal placement of dinnerware with a large basket for flatware.  I highly recommend this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Sweet Sounds of Nothing
txt: This dishwasher is the fourth that we have owned in 18 years. It is by far the quietest one we have ever purchased! Even have to check to make sure that it started! Highly recommend. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent
txt: This is the second of the same model Bosch dishwasher I have purchased. The 1st being 5 years old with zero problems. I highly recommend this unit. Super reliable, quiet, and the dishes always come out sparkling. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: DW’s Review
txt: The dishwasher is very quiet. I had to download a copy of the Onwers Manual to understand how to program the options, I would recommend a copy be provided with the purchase. Once I had that programming was fairly easy without that it was impossible. I like the Air Dry feature with the new energy efficiency requirements for dishwashers it really is needed otherwise dishes always come out too wet. I would recommend Bosch take a play out of the Apple hand book and make their programming of the options more self intuitive. Too many people will not understand how to work those optional functions and features. Otherwise a very quality machine/ [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love this machine!
txt: We absolutely love this dishwasher!  I have a standing joke with the family sarcastically apologizing for all the noise while running the dishwasher during their favorite TV shows...literally you can’t hear it and having the light shine down on the floor being the only indication that it’s on!  We love the the rack spacing and adjustability along with the 3rd rack above.  Thank you for building a quality product! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Disappointed
txt: We had a Airman's dishwasher for almost 20 years. It just stopped working.  It would have cost about $500 to fix it, so we decided to buy a new one. Bought the 500 series which on paper was similar to the one we had.  SOOO MUCH LOUDER.  My other dishwasher, you NEVER heard.   This one you don't need the red light, you know it's running.  This one is so cheaply made.  The door is flimsy, for the $$, I will not by another one.   The air feature is a cool idea, but dishes are still wet

title: Cleans and drys great!
txt: We purchased our dishwasher two months ago.  The dishes come out clean and dry,  except for the plastic which is understandable. We have several investment properties and had seven dishwashers over the past 10 years.   This by far has been the best dishwasher that we've had.  I highly recommend this model. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: What an upgrade

Holy smokes what a difference, not only does it clean the dishes better but it also dries them better and is so quiet we can hardly tell it's running! My only regret is that it took so long to buy one! I highly recommend to anyone of the fence, take the plunge! The online reviews says there the best! And they are! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clever design
txt:
We love this dishwasher.  There were several features that we thought were gimmicky when we bought it, but it got such good reviews for being quiet that we didn't care.  We were wrong about all of those features.

The utensil basket is amazing.  It has dozens of spots for silverware.  Way more than our family of four can fill in one load.  After a few uses of the dishwasher, I realized I hadn't had to clean any spoons after the dishwasher ran.  You know how there's always a spoon that has junk on it when you're putting the silverware away, well not in this dishwasher.

We also thought the third rack wouldn't be terribly useful.  Again, wrong!  It's great.  It fits all of our long utensils, except the ladle.  Very helpful and great if you have a party.  We love this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Nothing a cheaper dishwasher would not do better
txt: Gave up a cheap builder’s grade GE for this but would gladly go back to my cheap one. There is no room to put anything. We still end up handwashing half our dishes, so what is the point. It also retains a bad smell no matter what you do. The racks are not sturdy, and we could not install the braces to keep the didhwasher from tipping. Literally worst d/w I have ever had.

title: We have had this model for a month. Delivery was on time, fast, and could not have asked for a b...
txt: We have had this model for a month. Delivery was on time, fast, and could not have asked for a better experience. We had it running 2 days later and it's a world of difference from the 1977 Kitchen Aid we had. Easy to change settings, ridiculously quiet, and everything is spotlessly clean. Love the auto open feature. Completely thrilled with this purchase.

title: We purchased the Bosch 500 Series to replace our old dishwasher. Since we have hard water, we res...
txt:
We purchased the Bosch 500 Series to replace our old dishwasher. Since we have hard water, we researched and found the Bosch brand rated higher for hard water.
The Home Depot delivery went smoothly. We did purchase the dishwasher installation kit also. Everything was there. No missing parts. My husband installed everything without any issues or problems. 
It's been a month and I couldn't be happier with our Bosch dishwasher. We are truly amazed at how quiet it is! So quiet, when we first ran it we thought it wasn't working. I do suggest you use the products they recommend. They are a little pricier, but even your baked on casserole dish will come out clean. Also, read and follow the manual regarding how to load and use your settings. Sounds silly, but it's important. All dishwashers are not the same.
Overall, we recommend the Bosch 500 Series.

title: Bosch Dishwasher 500 series
txt:
The 1st time using this dishwasher I was unsure as to whether or not it was running.  Is the only way I knew it was on and running was when the drain cycle started. It washes dishes efficiently and very well.
 My only concern is when it it is done with the cycle that the dishes are not dry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very easy installation.  It's quiet when it runs.  It's got a lot of great options and it looks f...
txt: Very easy installation.  It's quiet when it runs.  It's got a lot of great options and it looks fantastic.  We love ours and highly recommend this dishwasher.

title: Always have enjoyed bosh products.
txt:
As a carpenter I've alway enjoyed the quality of bosh tools. So it was a no brainer picking bosh for our dishwaher. Easy to install. The One thing about that was it has a plug in cord, so I had to put in an electrical box. 
The dishwasher does have a slight smell to it after you run a load not sure what it is if it's the plastic from the trays, I thought it was like a new car smell that would eventually go away, but still has not. 
It does get the dishes sparkling clean and saves my hands from getting dried out. 
Overall we love our bosh dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Wonderful!
txt: My old Kitchen Aid dishwasher stopped working 2 days before Thanksgiving after 19 years of faithful service. With family and friends coming over for dinner on Thanksgiving I was a bit panicked to say the least. I tried to get the old dishwasher repaired but they no longer made the circuit board. Fortunately the repair man said if I found a dishwasher he could install it on Wednesday, the day before Thanksgiving. I asked him which brand he would buy and he replied "Bosch". After checking the local stores I found one and brought it home. After installation, I must say this thing runs like a dream. While my old Kitchen Aid was very reliable and did a fine job, it was loud. The Bosch is so quiet you can hardly tell if it's on. The dishes come out spotless and I love its versatility. The shelves are also very easy to adjust. Large wine glasses are no problem and the third rack is a nice bonus. If it lasts anywhere as long as my last dishwasher I'll have to say I bought a winner! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It really gets dishes with baked on food clean! Had a meatloaf pan and a lasagna pan i just rinse...
txt: It really gets dishes with baked on food clean! Had a meatloaf pan and a lasagna pan i just rinsed out the big pieces of food and stick it in there, no soaking, came out sparkling clean! So quiet too. I love the third rack, but the best part is the adjustable 2nd rack! Took a little getting used to with the loading from my last dishwasher, but I love it.

title: Well-engineered, made in USA.
txt: Well-engineered, made in USA.

title: My New Buddy

Holds a lot of dishes and utensils, and cleans them extremely well. Also, I have to mention how quiet this dishwasher is, during the entire cycle. Thanks to the indicator red light, I know when it is working, and when it is finished. Thank you Bosch... You guys did a great job. This Dishwasher makes it easier on me, and gives me more time to do other projects. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch
txt: Great dishwasher.  Does a great job washing the dishes and is very quiet [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 500 dishwasher
txt: This is the best dishwasher that I have ever owned. It actually cleans and dries. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super QUIET!
txt: Effective cleaning. I really appreciate the feature that automatically opens the DOOR to enable the dishes to air-dry. The top tack is easily removed when needing to clean extra-tall drink "travel" containers. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher - Super Quiet!
txt: I'm really loving my Bosch dishwasher. I had one at my prior home but I was a little hesitant with this purchase because I read a few poor reviews. I'm so glad I decided to go with Bosch. It offers all the features I need - speed wash, half load, auto, heavy, normal, delicate and sanitize. It says "silence plus" and at 44 dBA I don't even hear it running. I love the red light that reflects on the floor that tells me when the load is finished. It's a quality product and I believe it's superior to anything else on the market. My dishes are dry and spotless every time! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Fantastic dishwasher
txt: This dishwasher gets the dishes cleaner than clean I cannot believe how clean it gets them also it is so quiet that they had to put a red light on it to shine on the floor so you know it's running and on top of that it actually pops the door open after the dishes are done to help them dry I couldn't be more satisfied with this dishwasher I highly recommend it to anybody needing a new dishwasher you cannot go wrong with this one this is definitely is a winner [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: There are three things I look for in a dishwasher, they are how well it cleans dishes, how effici...
txt: There are three things I look for in a dishwasher, they are how well it cleans dishes, how efficient can I stack dishes, cutlery and glasses, and lastly how silent while in operation. This Bosch checks all the boxes for me. Let me start by saying I use to prewashing my dishes before placing them in the dishwasher. With this Bosch it is not necessary to do so. There are several options for loading dishes and everything normally placed inside, usually places large plates on the lower rack has adjustable tines that fold or slide to allow multiple options depending on what is being washed. The middle rack is height adjustable to allow taller stem ware to fit if desired and help maximize space. The 3rd upper rack is a great feature as works well for large cooking utensils like tongs, spatulas, measuring cups, cutlery and flatware. At the rated 44 decible rating this dishwasher is extremely quiet and need to be right next to it to hear it in operation. There is a red light that shines down on the floor to let you know its status. There are lots of options for different washing cycles ranging from a quick rinse to heavy which will clean baked-on pots, pans and dishes. I normally put the cycle on "Auto" and let the dishwasher determine how long the wash cycle should be. I do use Finish Jet-Dry for a rinsing agent and it helps dry everything including plastics. Overall, I am extremely impressed by the Bosch 500 series dishwasher and look forward to years of terrific performance.

title: The Bosch 500 Series Top Control Tall Tub Bar Handle Dishwasher in Stainless Steel with Stainless...
txt:
The Bosch 500 Series Top Control Tall Tub Bar Handle Dishwasher in Stainless Steel with Stainless Steel Tub, AutoAir, 44dBA is an outstanding dishwasher. In our neighborhood social media app someone asked for dishwasher recommendations. Nearly all of the recommendations were "Buy a Bosch." And they are as good as you've heard. Installation was not complicated but required cutting a new hole in the sink cabinet for the supply and drain lines. They have to be placed as per the directions. The machine is pretty much a complete block with little unoccupied space. The unit is perhaps 2mm or 3mm taller that the unit being replaced. Since the previous homeowner installed a thick stone floor cover I had to temporarily raise the counter 2mm or 3mm to insert the Bosch. Once in place the counter was placed back where it was and the everything was secure. There are some mounting tabs on each side that worked but not as described in the installation instructions. In the end the only items I needed to acquire was a dishwasher supply hose (mine included the 90 deg adapter from 3/8 braided to a 3/4 male hose) as well an electrical for a new outlet. The unit being replaced was direct wired while the Bosch has a power cord with a three prong plug. 

After installation a dishwasher has to clean dishes well, do it quietly, be easy to use and look good. This Bosch aces all of those. The first several loads of dishes were a concern because an oily film seemed to form on the inside of the door. A switch in detergents seems to have solve that problem. The unit has washing programs from easy to clean to tough baked on. They all do an excellent job. This Bosch is very quiet. When our old unit was running a conversation in the kitchen was not possible. Even watching TV in the living room was tough. Not with this Bosch. It is the quietest dishwasher we have ever owned. We can run it anytime without worrying about the noise. The touch selections on the top of the door are easy to use. While there are a number of washing options to choose from, we generally just go with the Auto cycle with has a food sensing feature. We like the time remaining indicator. This unit has an AutoAir Dry feature which opens the door ajar once the cycle is over. That enhances drying and lets fresh air in. That is a neat feature when you can't be there when the cycle is done. Lastly, the Bosch 500 series is stainless steel with a clean look the fits perfectly with our other kitchen appliances. 

This Bosch has an enormous number of features that we are learning to use. Great dishwasher!

title: The Bosch 44 DBA 500 series is a work of art. The engineering that has gone into this is over d...
txt: The Bosch 44 DBA 500 series is a work of art. The engineering that has gone into this is over do. The installation went well. I have installed a lot of dishwashers. Things are finally getting easier. This machine has the water supply and electrical on the back side. That means you don’t have to reach through jagged metal edges and manipulate tools with the tips of your fingers. The bottom of the machine he’s a built in catch pan for any water that may leak and turns off water to avoid a flood and a insurance claim. The leg adjustment is much easier. The front are easy to access. The rear leg adjustment is a thousand times easier than the old system. All you need is a straight screw driver and turn till level. After an easy install, time to run this thing. l was a little disappointed with the drying of the dishes. I called customer support, they explained a condensation drying system. Meaning, hot water washes and heats the dishes. The steam that comes off the dishes condenses on the stainless tub. Allowing the warm dishes to dry. They also explained choosing the sanitizer and auto air option which pops open the door at end of cycle allowing moisture to escape. Due to epa and energy restrictions, the have to do the job with less. It helped reaching out and getting information from the source.

title: This Bosch 500 SERIES TOP CONTROL TALL TUB BAR HANDLE DISHWASHER IN STAINLESS STEEL WITH STAINLES...
txt: This Bosch 500 SERIES TOP CONTROL TALL TUB BAR HANDLE DISHWASHER IN STAINLESS STEEL WITH STAINLESS STEEL TUB, 44DBA is not only the best dishwasher I have ever used, it is the best household appliance I have used. Whisper quiet, without the indicator light, you would never realize it is on. So many very positive, easy to use, engineered design features, that to describe them all would require a book. Adjustable trays... not the traditional two drawer, but three drawers with a top rack for cutlery. Easy top door controls, easy slide detergent dispensers, for liquid and jet dry, or pods, or tablets. My favorite feature was easily the end of cycle door opening, to stop the condensation, and leave every item dry. A wonderful, and well made, designed, and intuitive machine. And did I say "and beautiful iconic design"? A classic.

title: This Bosch dishwasher makes a very attractive addition to any kitchen. And besides a pretty face...
txt: This Bosch dishwasher makes a very attractive addition to any kitchen. And besides a pretty face it's also great at cleaning. My first use I put in some deliberately nasty dishes and all came out sparkling. I was a little disappointed that beads of water still clung to some items after the wash - but the excellent Bosch control panel has an "Extra Dry" option and the problem was solved. The interior is well laid out, though I found the third top rack more of an annoyance and removed it. The machine is so quiet I had to put my ear against it to make sure it was running. It even has a quarter-size red light that shines on the floor to tell you it is still at work. This is a great machine, you are sure to love. See the included photos for details.

title: Dynamic BOSCH Dishwasher This is by far one of the quietest dishwashers on the market. It is so q...
txt:
Dynamic BOSCH Dishwasher

This is by far one of the quietest dishwashers on the market. It is so quiet that a red spotlight is built in to project on your floor to let you know the dishwasher is operating. The convenience of a third shelf for silver and small items like ramekins provides adequate space without taking up room on the two other racks. All items washed in the dishwasher come out sparkling clean. I use the recommended pods and rinse liquid to enhance the cleanliness of the content. The accompanying instruction book provides all the information needed to use the control panel on top of the door. I am extremely pleased with the appearance and capability of this dishwasher.

Best dishwasher upgrade yet, hands down! Our old dishwasher had done a pretty good job, but often times some items still had to be hand cleaned. The new Bosch stainless steel was as functional as it was beautiful. Having the controls on the door top also keeps the little ones out of mischief when my sons family comes over. It does a wonderful job the first time and everything comes out completely clean. The new innovations were also a pleasant surprise, requiring the GFCI connection and a direct plug in, instead of removing a metal box and having to hard wire. No doubt, this will get a lot of use.

title: I am very disappointed in how this dishwasher has performed...
txt: I am very disappointed in how this dishwasher has performed in its first two months. We got an error code (E22) every second or third load from the start. A repairman replaced the drain pump but we've still gotten that error code a couple more times. The bottom rack is nearly impossible to pull in /out smoothly when its loaded (works great when empty) and hard to get to sit evenly on the supports to run the load - if it falls crooked, it blocks the lower rotating water source so the dishes don't get cleaned. We noticed a small crack in the lower rack so hopefully that is the problem and the rack will work better once its replaced but we suspect its a design flaw.

title: I bought this Bosch dishwasher to replace my 20 year old Bosch dishwasher.  This Bosch dishwasher...
txt: I bought this Bosch dishwasher to replace my 20 year old Bosch dishwasher.  This Bosch dishwasher exceeded my expectations.  It is incredibly quiet, you don’t even know it’s running.  They improved the drying mechanism, this was one complaint with my old one is that it did not always completely dry the dishes.  This Bosch dishwasher has numerous features.  I particularly like the half load wash feature and the delay feature.  I will keep buying Bosch because they are very reliable.  My only complaint was Home Depot’s delivery and installation company.  The delivery company they used brought the machine without the installation kit I bought and then I had to wait an extra four days to have them install it.  The person that did the installation did not read the installation manual an did not loop the drain line correctly, did not level the machine, rested the machine on the kick panel and told me that the two screw holes in the panel did not line up so it did not need to be screwed in with the two screws that were supplied.  He also did not find the vapor recovery gasket on the back of the machine that was supplied to be installed between the counter and the machine so now there is a gap there.  Home Depot needs to hire better delivery an installation contractors.

title: Very quiet operation.

title: So quiet, but requires some careful loading
txt: We didn't think noise was a big factor, but the difference in how quiet this dishwasher is compared to our last one is much appreciated.  You will have to be very strategic in loading it - I completely understand people's complaints that you can't load as much.  Also, we do notice a slight difference in cleanliness if you don't use a rinse aid.  We've had ours for a month, and no issues with smell.  The air dry function works great (and probably helps with reducing any smell) - I was concerned about how wet dishes would be, but we let them sit for another hour or so after the door opens at the end of the cycle before unloading, and everything is dry except the sometimes plastics need additional dry time.  Hoping this lasts longer than our other (different brand) dishwasher, which stopped funcioning well after 6 years. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This dishwasher is worth the little bit more money you...
txt: This dishwasher is worth the little bit more money you will spend.  We had bad luck with a similar priced but different brand dishwasher.  The Bosch is high quality, can hold a ton of dishes, gets everything very clean.  Also very quiet and has some nice wash options.  We use the air dry option for overnight washings and love it!

Perhaps the best feature is the automatic open. When I unload the dishes and utensils in the morning, they actually are dry. I couldn't be more pleased. Fortunately the dishwasher in our new home was old enough where it needed to be replaced and we immediately searched Bosch dishwashers for a replacement. txt: I replaced a Miele with this unit, so it was a slight step down, however, still an excellent choice.  Had a comparable Samsung at first, but it was terrible. Also, sometimes it seems to change programs.  In other words, I can select 'normal' and 'air dry', yet at the end of the cycle it won't open on it's own.  When I manually open the door, it is on 'auto' and nothing else.  We've had the unit about 6 weeks and this has happened 3 or 4 times, running almost daily.  Strange, but not a huge issue.  Overall, I'm very pleased with the quality.  It also holds many more dishes than older models. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I just take a towel and dab it dry!  I like the the third tray for my silverware and utensils easy to to load and especially unloading.  Leaves room on the bottom rack for large items.  The one con I have is that I don't like the way the lights stay on until I turn them off.  It could be several hours before I get to it!  Overall I give it a 5 star rating. Lucky for me, this appliance was in stock.  I couldn't be happier.  The machine is really quiet, does an amazing job and has perfect options.  Finally, I love the top third shelf. We decided to spend an extra hundred and get the next model up. This is so quiet it has a red light shining on the floor to let you know its running. Cleans all the dishes including 3rd rack without any prewashing. We love ours [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Luv it

title: I love my new dishwasher
txt: My new Bosch 500 Series dishwasher does a great job of cleaning my dishes.  And it is whisper-quiet!  The quiet is especially valuable to me, because I live in a condo.  The dishwasher goes to work with no impact on my entertainig in the living room.

title: Misleading info
txt:
The description of this dish washer shows a top "silverware" rack.  There isn't one.  
It cleans and dries the dishes quite well.  Doesn't hold as many dishes as our old washer.  Would be a 4 if it would have had the top tray as shown in the pictures.

title: Best shelf configuration, best cleaning, quietist!
txt:
Best Dishwasher I've ever bought! I was REALLY concerned about the hefty price tag, but I needed a didhwasher now (chronic pain prevents me from doing all our dishes by hand), and there was only top of the line or bottom of the heap available because of Covid. 
   We've never had a Bosch but had always heard they were excellent! This has certainly justified it's price point! The 1st feature we were attracted to, was the Leak guard- after 2 dishwashers breaking and flooding, damaging our Laminate floors (the latest one's water pump broke & shot water onto the floor + right in the basement the last time we turned it on & went outside!) we love Leakguard! Plus we love the features I mentioned in the title. We have a spring fed well that has a lot of water but not pressure, and this Bosch still manages to get dishes cleaner than any other brand we've ever had! Plus I can put SO many dishes and utensils in it! For the 2 of us, I don't even need the Cutlery Basket! ... can't even hear it when it's running, but love the red light on the floor telling us it is! Love, love the feature where the door pops open at the end to save some electricity in the drying & dishes come out dryer overall! 
  Only one slight little problem and it might have been our installers mistake because it is not in the whole lined up exactly with the counter -one side sticks out more- The middle shelf keeps rolling out and won't hardly ever stay in while loading the other shelves. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great machine
txt: I would recommend this machine for the following reasons: quiet, good interior design, cleans and dries beautifully.  I would suggest a third shelf on top for small utensils/plastics.

title: Almost Perfect

txt: Have had appliance for about 3 motns now and and enjoying using it.  Quiet and provides good sopacing for items [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher
txt: As expected this dishwasher is very quiet. I love that the door pops open when it's done to air dry the dishes. I always just use the auto setting, it takes 3 hours which seems a bit long but plan accordingly. I love the top rack for silverware and utensils. It takes me awhile to get a full load of dishes and they can start smelling before I run a cycle, so I always keep the door open at the same angle that it pops open when it's done. So its open 4 inches which is kind of annoying to walk around, but a necessary thing for my usage. I also like that this doesn't have a handle sticking out that gets caught on my pants pockets when I walk by it. All the controls are on top and hidden under my counter when closed. It was easy self-installation. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishing the scoop on my new Bosch!
txt: It takes a little getting used to with no heating element, but once I was over that hurdle, I really like my new dishwasher. It is quiet, and I like the new rack configuration. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet little clean machine

Anything on the top rack, like coffee cups or ramekins, have water on the top of them.  Other than this, my dishes get really clean and the glasses have no residue.  I love, love, love how quiet it runs! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Haven't quite figured out what to do with the space where the removable basket is and haven't quite figured out what to use that basket for since I use the top rack for knives, spoons, forks, etc.  But extremely quiet, cleans and dries well, like the red light that tells me it is on.

The three rack system is great and the dishwasher is so quiet. It's been a huge benefit to have a quiet dishwasher while working from the room next to the kitchen during the pandemic! It does an excellent job cleaning, even heavily spiked cookware and there are so many customizable options, I would look nonforther when I’m the market for a new DW. This is my second Bosch since we recently bought a new home, and will never buy another brand. We loved our 2018 Series 300, which is a little less money and would be a comparable and great option as well. I noticed with this 500 series, the front is easier to clean and leaves less steak marks than the 300. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

My only suggestions would be to add a little more depth to the top cutlery basket so that you could place small low cups or large spoon ladels on top. title: Bosch Dishwasher Has Changed Our Lives!
txt: Our old dishwasher was so loud we had to turn the TV way up to hear over it. We were even thinking of adding doors to our dining room to block the sound! Our new Bosch 500 Series dishwasher is so quiet, you can only hear it or know it's running when the water discharges.  The door opens automatically when the wash cycle is complete, to let steam out, so I can let it run before bed and know that the dishes will be perfectly dry in the morning, and I don't have to wait for cycle to be finished to open the door! LOVE the look, style and quality so much that we will be purchasing a new stove and refrisgerator soon! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent Design
txt: After years of dirty dishes from a dishwasher we decided to upgrade. I of course did not want just any dishwasher. I was on the hunt for one that was both reliable and cleaned dishes well. After months of research from reading reviews and testimonies I wanted to check out the few hopefuls in person. The Bosch design was a clear winner. One or our favorite aspects is the top silverware drawer. No more basket taking up room or hanging on the door. We also love that the top rack can be raised and lowered if needed. Which is has been several times. As for cleaning, this machine has surpassed our expectations. Previously we has to run a load twice and still deal with water spots. Which the Bosch we run it once and everything is sparkling clean. The one feature I was hard pressed to get was Auto Dry. After the load is complete the door pops open and lets everything air dry. It's an amazing feature even though it is so simple. One last thing we did notice was the noise level of this machine. We actually can't hear it running, at all. The previous machine sounded like a baby rhino playing with a pressure washer. dishes crashing around water spray noise for three hours. It was aweful. Two loads and 6 hours later we would be scrubbing water spots. Now we are blissfully running a silent machine any time we want knowing in only 2 hours the load will be complete and everything will be clean. Thank you Bosch, this machine is a marvel of engineering. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

We also love the fact that it opens automatically when the cleaning finishes ( this is an option ). We also enjoy having the top slid out shelf. The only reason we did not give it a 5 was due to it's sensitivity when something may be loaded incorrectly. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt:
My wife picked this machine out. Her sister recommended Bosch. It was delivered about 6 weeks ago and so far my wife loves it. This is the quietest dish washer we have ever owned.
My wife likes the air dry function where the machine pops the door open to let the dishes dry.
So far two thumbs up. I will update if anything changes.

title: Just what a small house needed
txt: My dishwasher was 10 years old and it wasn't working the way it used to, so I went to work researching dishwashers.  I knew I wanted a quieter dishwasher because my small house has open space between the kitchen and living room and my old dishwasher was, well, super loud.  After months of research and saving up and finding a weekend where we could install it ourselves, we bought the Bosch 500 Series.  It's everything I wanted and then some.  I love the fact that I can run the 500 and watch television or read a book at the same time.  I love that I can take conference calls sitting 10 feet away from it and nobody knows it's on.  I could write for an hour about how clean my dishes are! Definitely worth the investment. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pay attention when installing the water supply adapter that it’s...
txt: Pay attention when installing the water supply adapter that it’s fitted nicely without wobble. If the fitting will leak you will get the motherboard wet then the leak sensor will interrupt the functions.you will have to remove the motherboard cover and use a fan to dry and wipe all the water from the base. Bosch you redesign where the water supply inlet will not compromise the electronic components when it leaks.

title: Amazing
txt: I was very happy to purchase this after all the wonderful reviews I had read. I am happy to say I agree. The machine has a odor which I did not notice in my last machine but I do nit run it everyday so perhaps that is the issue. Otherwise, great!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Peace and quiet
txt: It is heavenly, being able to watch and listen to the TV or have a conversation at the table while the dishwasher is running and there is no need to turn up the volume or to raise ones voice to be heard.  That was what we had to do with our 26 year old dishwasher while it attempted to clean our dishes; and it do do an adequate job.  But our new Bosch, it is a heavenly experience avery time we use.  Total peace and quiet!  Thank goodness for the little red light that shines on the floor while running, otherwise one would think its not working, it is that quiet.  And talk about it doing its job.  The dishes and glassware come out sparkling clean, and the utinsils, pots, pans baking dishes, well, it is abosolutely amazing the job it does.  And the greatest thing about it is there is no pre-rinsing  of dishes etc. before loading them into the dishwasher.  Just follow the instructions and one cannot go wrong, and that includes the installation instructions.  Good job Bosch, but then I may be a bit partial to Bosch because most of my woodworking tools are Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

It’s great right from the start, can’t even hear it, the red light that shines on the floor is the only way I know if it’s on, then the feature that the door opens to let steam escape to allow plastic to dry faster is perfect. I’ve done a lot of searching for what is better for me well this is the best pick for me. So I definitely would recommend this to my friends and family.

title: Bosch Diswasher
txt:
After going through three diswashers in five years, we decided to up our game to purchase a higher-level product that had great reviews. After hearing from several friends who swear by Bosch, we found the perfect diswasher for us. One of my favorite features include the adjustable racks- suitable for our large dinner plates, wine glasses, and the pot from our Instant Pot.  I also LOVE the top shelf that is hidden. It is perfect for lids, utensils and other oddly shaped pieces. 
 I also LOVE how the door releases and opens as the final step of the cleaning process. I start the machine when I go to bed and dishes are dry when I come to empty it in the morning. Finally, the low level of noise from the washer when in use is AMAZING! We will never buy another dishwasher from any other company. The BOSCH is the only way to go! I am thrilled with the product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We did a lot of research before making the decision on this Bosch model. The only difference we s...
txt: We did a lot of research before making the decision on this Bosch model. The only difference we saw between it and the step up and step down models was the drying options. We chose the 500 series because of the AutoAir feature. The door pops open and lets out the heat/steam from the dry cycle so the dishes can actually dry. All of these new dishwashers are so air tight that if you don't open the door the steam has nowhere to go and the dishes are covered in condensation. I didn't believe that a dishwasher could be so quiet that you don't know it is running, but I am now a believer. It is a good thing it projects a red beam of the floor to confirm it is on because sometimes that is the only way I know it is running. No more having to wait until we go to bed to run a cycle. One of the other selling points the Bosch machines had was the 3rd rack on top for silverware/utensils. No more wasting room on the bottom with the removable basket to hold silverware. Everything fits nice and neat on the top rack and also has room for shallow storage containers, lids and water bottle lids. We have had our Bosch for almost a month and run it nearly every day. I am kicking myself for not buying it sooner. I didn't realize my old dishwasher was not getting my dishes as clean as this machine. I always contributed my dishes not shining to our hard South Texas water, even with rinse aid and a hard water supplement. This machine has proved it is not the water. We still use rinse aid, but no longer need the hard water supplement and the dishes still look cleaner than our last dishwasher could accomplish.

title: This seems to be a solid, dependable dishwasher.  We...
txt: This seems to be a solid, dependable dishwasher.  We like most of the features.  The downside is that on no settings do all of the dishes get completely dry.  Even on auto with sanitize, we have to check each item and hand dry about half of them.

txt: Fantastic dishwasher. Very clean dishes, super quiet while running, very happy with the purchase.

Excellent product.  Very quiet and cleans dishes very well.  You have the option to set it to automatically open a little when it's done instead of beeping which I love.

It's a bit on the pricier side so keep that in mind.

title: This is the third Bosch dishwasher we have purchased.  The product is high quality with very nice...
txt:
This is the third Bosch dishwasher we have purchased.  The product is high quality with very nice features.  It is extremely quiet and we like the incognito front panel design.

I would recommend Bosch products for their quality and fine performance.

title: Well worth the money even if I was skeptical upfront....
txt:
Well worth the money even if I was skeptical upfront. I've gone through 3 dish washers in the last 5 years (moving/remodeling) and this dishwasher noticeably cleans my dishes and glassware better than the other dishwashers. I'd also note those dishwashers were only 3-6 year old models so relatively reasonable comparisons. 

I live in a low humidity area and the auto air pop/open feature works great for drying the dishes as I usually don't unload the dishwasher for a few hours after the cycle finishes.

title: Really good performance, really bad doc
txt:
There's an adage that nothing ruins a good price like bad service. In this case, nothing ruins a good product like bad manuals... and color choices.

The machine itself is very well-designed, extremely efficient, and fabulous at cleaning dishes. It's just not intuitively obvious to use.

The manuals (documentation) is something only an engineer could love. Components are highlighted with numbers, not with callouts that describe their function, and the legend for those numbers is on a different page. And when you get around to the operating instructions, you need to refer back to those numbers (on one page) and legend (on another). So there's a lot of (avoidable) flipping back and forth.

Then try changing a setting on the control panel. Go ahead. Push the On/Off button and then try to change to something other than Auto. I'll wait. Until you press and hold the Start button for a moment (a procedure which, found buried in the manual, resets the panel), you can't make another choice. Oh, yeah, sure, that's obvious. It would be like first having to disconnect your car battery any time you wanted to change gears.

Red may mean go in Germany, but not in the States. So when the machine is on, and its red light shines on the floor, the first implication is that it's a warning light, not an "on" light. Then, when the light goes off and one would assume that the cycle is complete, it's not. The washing has stopped, but the drying has not. Must be a Teutonic thing that escapes the comprehension of a simple American.

To other people, these might be charming German quirks. To me, they're as bad as all those American firms that (years ago) didn't see the point in translating their brochures from English into the languages of the countries they sold to. There are cultural differences that are just as important, and they need to be adopted... even when it's something  as simple as changing a light bulb cover from red to green. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: worst dishwasher ever
txt: Not sure what the hype is about bosch dishwashers but after living with this thing for 4 months, I’ve come to loath it. Sure its a little quieter than our old GE dishwasher but thats the only plus. The soap dispensor is a joke and due to its placement and design, it requires you to use 1 type of soap or wind up with soap caked and oozing from the dispensor at the end of the cycle. The layout of the dish racks makes little sense and we regularly find ourselves fighting with it to just get the days dirty dishes washed. The autoair feature has to be one of the worst designs put into production. From day one, our dishes were never dry. Regardless if we used the higher temp sanitize option or not. So now when a cycle is done, were now drying every dish off as we empty it. As an added bonus, if something does happen to dry on Its own, its so spotted and covered in a fine film that we end up washing it again by hand. This issue is persistent with or without rinse aid.  If i could give this thing a negative score i absolutely would. I now dream of the day that i can finally rip this piece of junk out and leave it on the side of a very remote and abandoned road!

The dishwasher I had before was supposed to be top of the line, but it did not get the dishes clean, and left a residue on them. I had numerous service people out to "work" on it but it never got any better. I even thought it was my well water. But my new Bosch gets the disher sparkling clean, and leaves no residue at all. title: Bad decomposition Toxic sewage smell , no air flow
txt: These dishwasher have a serious flaw in there design, that flaw seems to be no air flow when you close the door. You put dirty dishes in close the door and within just a few hours it smells like a sewage. I never had this problem with my old dishwasher.  If you were to leave dirty dishes in for let’s say a week you would need a hazmat suite on before you open the door. The dishwasher seems to act like some kind of greenhouse decomposition chamber. The only way to prevent this is to leave the door hanging open; great look that does not get in the way all (sarcasm off). I do not recommend any buy any of these Bosch models, they are not sanitary.

title: Anticipation and first impressions
txt:
After several years of listening to the loud dishwasher, that still worked, I had the opportunity to replace it. Understanding that, during this COVID crisis, appliances were hard to come by leaving a lot of people waiting months for their replacements. I had the choice of this 500 Series model or a competitor equivelant. I chose the Bosch for its reputation and because, since I am a plumbing contractor and have installed hundreds over the last 24 years, I recognized its build quality right away. Now after a month my impression is that it is freakishly quiet. I like the organization options of the racks and its various run modes. 

After the first few times using it, I noticed  the door was open. I thought my teenage daughter grabbed a glass or something and forgot to close it, or better yet... empty it like she was supposed to. After the third time I walked into her room and said that if she did it again, she couldn't go out over the weekend. She swore up and down that it wasn't her... so I waited close by during a forth use and when it seemed almost complete I noticed it opened itself to let the remaining moisture breath - just like it stated in the instruction manual I should have read. Haha... point is that even us guys should read the instructions. I love this dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: New Bosch SHXM65Z55M - First Impressions
txt:
Just finished installing this new dishwasher and ran it through a test cycle.  This is the 3rd dishwasher that has been installed in this particular spot in our kitchen,  The prior two, a GE and then later a Kitchenaid, had the water hookup and the electric hookup within the same space as the dishwasher which actually worked out pretty well.  Since this dishwasher requires that you connect the electric and water supply in the adjacent cabinet (typically the cabinet with the sink) I had to modify the water supply and the electric supply to move them into the adjacent cabinet.  Not a real fan of this as you can't really tell how everything is lining up in the back of the cabinet as you push the dishwasher in and pull the slack from the drain line, the water supply line and electric cord through the opening into the sink cabinet.  You can't see under this dishwasher at all when it is in position.  The older dishwashers provided a view of everything under the dishwasher allowing replacement of some components if there were a problem without having to uninstall the dishwasher.  The adjustable front feet are not the easiest to work with when leveling the dishwasher.  The past dishwashers I have had experience with had a spot where you could put a little 1/4" drive socket on the top of the leveling foot so that you could easily wrench the feet to where you wanted them.  The feet on the Bosch have slots in the bottom of the feet that you have to manipulate with a screw driver about 1/6 of a turn at a time.  It takes quite a while to get it set to the right height and level.  There is a center screw for adjusting the rear foot which is actually very easy to use.  There are only 3 feet on this dishwasher so it sets up like a tri-pod which makes it easier to get it very level.  

I got everything hooked up and turned it on for a short cycle just to make sure that everything worked fine and I had no leaks.  They advertise this as a quiet dishwasher and provide an LED that illuminates on the floor so that you can tell it is running.  If you need to see the LED to know that this dishwasher is running, you are deaf.  This dishwasher is not that quiet, and it is definitely not as quiet as the Kitchenaid we just replaced.  I wouldn't call it objectionable, but it is definitely going to take getting used to as it is a lot noisier than what we are used to.  They could have saved some money on that gimic LED to tell you that it is running.  

Also found a self tapping flange bolt in the bottom of the shipping materials when I opened it up.  The bolt didn't appear as though it had ever been threaded in, and I couldn't find a spot for it to go, but that didn't make me feel good to find a loose bolt.  

We hated to give up our Kitchenaid but an electric surge got into it burned out a bunch of stuff in it.

title: Mixed Bag
txt:
Let me start out with the positives:  (1) truly whisper quiet (the thing with the laser dot on the floor -- you would not always be sure whether the machine was running without it); (2) cleans really well; (3) dries decently but not super well; (4) adjustable rack is pretty useful; and (5) the third rack for utencils is very neat, works pretty good, and makes sorting and emptying a breeze.  Now the negatives (which are a bit harder to quantify):  (6) the front door on this dishwasher looks great but feels super cheap and does not convey quality (we previously owned a less expensive Bosch bought a decade ago and it felt more sturdy); (7) the racks feel cheap and fragile (they are seem very lightweight (which is good) but feel as if you could break them by mistake (not so good) -- it makes adjusting the middle rack a bit scary); (8) the basket on the bottom rack has almost no capacity and the things we manage to put in them tend to not get clean; and (9) the third rack does not seemed to allow for curved utencils -- it is as if Bosch expects all of our flatware to actually be flat.

I trust the Bosch brand based on our great experience with the prior dishwasher.  I hope this dishwasher proves to be the rule rather than the exception.  But the overall feel of this machine is definitely cheaper than the machine we bought before for less.  Go figure. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Fantastic Dishwasher

title: Bosch dishwasher — a winner!
txt: I’m enjoying everything about my new dishwasher.  It cleans everything I throw at it.  I always choose the option of “Auto Dry” that pops the door open at the end of the cycle to vent steam.  This does a fine job of drying the dishes.  The only thing I wish for is that it’s hard to easily tell when I’ve added enough rinse aid.  I often overflow a bit if I add too much. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Runs a long time
txt: It runs a long time but dishes have never been cleaner. Really like the adjustments such as how much rinse aid to use. I took out the silverware basket and just use the top tray. Works great, makes more space below.

title: Absolute best quality product
txt: From start to finish, this dishwasher was easy to install with the instructions provided.  This is a very solid unit and does not compare to the less quality units we have owned over the years.  You do truly get what you pay for. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Machine
txt: We love our new dishwasher! Easy to install, no-brainer use and our dishes and glassware have never looked better.a [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It's really quiet and does an amazing job. Only issue it does not come with a use manual. I had a...
txt: It's really quiet and does an amazing job. Only issue it does not come with a use manual. I had a lot of issues as the manual I was able to find on line are not very clear. It's not a straight forward thing as I couldn't turn off the lights after using the Air Dry feature as well as any other feature. You physically have to hit the off button. Which is crazy bc I run my dishwasher at night after we go to bed. The manual did explain how to change that factory setting but like I said wasn't easy. So it received 4 stars as an overall rating. If it wasn't for the on line book I would be at a total loss. It cleans the dishes well and has an amazing third rack for small things and silverware. No handle sticks out and although I mentioned quiet it is sooo quiet you won't realize it's on.

title: Our new Bosch diswasher
txt: Very impressed with this appliance, how the dishes are left clean,  and the quietness with which it operates. Only issue was an odor noticed anytime the dishwasher was opened when it had a load of dirty dishes. But a calm to your service number explained that should not fully close the door between loaded allowing some air to circulate. That alleviated our issue. So besides an excellent appliance your company also has a respectful and knowledgable service department. We highly recommend this brand of appliances. This is the first Bosch productive own and will definitely consider your entire product line going forward. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet unit
txt: I was not aware that a dishwasher could be this quiet. We're it not for the light, one wouldn't even know it was running. Does a great job as well [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: I really like this dishwasher so far!  It's silent and deadly to dirty dishes!  So far the only thing I have not seen it clean well is a very dirty caked on peanut butter knife. My glasses and dishes SPARKLE. Only had it a couple of months but very pleased with my purchase.

My larger glasses don't fit so I have to put them on the bottom. I guess a second improvement that could be done is the bottom rack has an container for serving and cooking utensils - they don't set in there too well I use the the top rack (not silverware rack) to lay it down in for a better fit. Minor issues - by far the best dishwasher I've ever owned!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Regardless dishes are always wet at end of whatever cycle and have to be hand dried ... apparently no heated air cycle. It is very quiet and looks good but do t think I would buy it again. I need a printed manual don't want to have to search online for instructions! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: A fantastic purchase!
txt: I hadn't ever purchased a dishwasher before, so I did some research before we purchased - and asked friends and family for advice. Overwhelmingly, people favored Bosch - and they were right. Our dishes get clean (the glassware is sparkling!), and it is SO QUIET. We are very pleased with our purchase! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 Series Dishwasher - very satisfied
txt: I have always wanted a Bosch Dishwasher.  Mainly for the reputation of it operating quietly.  It is so quiet on the automatic setting that I cannot hear it running.  Some of the other settings - like speed 60 - are a bit louder, but still SO MUCH quieter than my previous dishwasher.  If your dishwasher is in the heart of the home like mine, you need the quiet perfromance offered by this Bosch dishwasher.  The dishwasher also performs excellently.  My dishes and glassware are always clean and spot free.  I like the programable automatic door opening air dry feature.  The adjustable middle rack makes it easy to fit all sizes of items.  The filter is very easy to clean.  The buttons are on the top panel which lends to a clean, neat aesthetic in the kitchen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dry
txt: This dishwasher does not dry as well as older units. I did not buy it to hand dry dishes! I have read the users instructions many times and found no remedy. This product was made to wash not dry! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Love the third rack and laser red light. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quietest Dishwasher Ever!
txt: Purchased a BOSCH 500 Series dishwasher with air dry function about 1 month ago. The dishwasher is very quiet, cleans my dishes well, and looks sleek in my kitchen. I have 2 minor complaints...the first is that streaks and fingerprints show on the front. The fingerprintless model was not available in the line I wanted. The other complaint is the need to close the door within 4 seconds of pushing start. This function had not been explained to me upon installation. I had to contact the BOSCH helpline to learn how to reset the control panel. Assume that this could be a common problem encountered by new owners. Otherwise, the dishwasher is wonderful and I would purchase it again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher is very quiet but normal cycle with air dry...
txt:
Dishwasher is very quiet but normal cycle with air dry is 3 hrs! there is a 60 min cycle so that's what I use.  My old washer was a 10 yr old GE monogram. I'm not a big fan of GE equipment but it does feel heaver and more solid than the Bosch.  I've only had the Bosch for 2 weeks. so I'll update this review later. 

Delivery was a disaster - did not come with extra parts I ordered and delivery people would not take old washer unless it was disconnected, wished they told me that before hand. Also trying to call Home Depot helpline is useless. Waste hours being on hold and nobody knows or can do anything.  

Conclusion: Washer seems good (self-install was huge pain!) but too early to tell, delivery service and HD help terrible.  Probably a good idea to buy from another vendor.

title: Good Dishwasher

The factory stopped making the one I wanted in the color I wanted. Pretty crappy if you ask me. Too lazy to make both colors!  Not everyone want stainless steel!  I had to settle for a lesser model. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Let me start by saying my previous dishwasher was horrible.  I would almost have to have the dish...
txt: Let me start by saying my previous dishwasher was horrible.  I would almost have to have the dishes clean before putting them in the dishwasher.  As started my search for a new one, I read everything I could and researched so much.  The Bosch 500 series is amazing.  I understand why it has to have a light on the floor to show it is running!  It is quiet and cleans so well.  Dishes with sauce (not cleaned like I had to for the previous dishwasher) came out spotless.  The Air Dry option is amazing.  The dishes are barely wet when I empty it.  Again, my previous dishwashers air dry option everything was still so wet.  The third rack is great for so many little items I can now fit more dishes because so  much can go in the third rack.  I have had it for about a month now and I have no complaints!
