title: Love it!
txt: I didn't think my old dishwasher was very loud, but boy, was I wrong.  When I ran my new Bosch for the first time, my husband actually thought it wasn't working because we couldn't hear it!  It was working of course.  The only time you really notice it running is when it drains.  I was a little worried the newer dishwasher wouldn't dry as well as my old GE, but with the AutoAir even the plastics are dry.  It seems to hold a lot more dishes as well, so we don't have to run it (and empty it) as frequently. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Still getting used to optimizing the space it offers, but...
txt: Still getting used to optimizing the space it offers, but the third rack is amazing and the auto-open feature is worth the upcharge. Dishes always come out clean and dry.

title: I love my new dishwasher so far.  I have...
txt: I love my new dishwasher so far.  I have only had it less than a month.  I do not even have to wash the dishes.  Install was slightly more complicated than expected.  You either have to pay 30 extra dollars for a special cord or have a plug in for it to work.  you also need a 5 dollar plumbing part that I felt should just come with the dishwasher since you can not hook it up to water with out it.

title: This thing is so quiet. Cleans relatively well. Heavy loads...
txt: This thing is so quiet. Cleans relatively well. Heavy loads may leave a lil bit of residue or grit, but all in all very satisfied. The auto dry actually works at reducing condensation.

title: Silence is Golden

title: Significant improvement
txt: After 5 years (just before the extended warranty expired) our LG dishwasher began to display error messages.  It hasn't been cleaning well except  on power scrub for several months.  We decided to spend the extra money to get the Bosch, and are very glad that we did.  Quiet, great cleaning, and convenient rack system for everything from posts to flatware.  Highly recommended. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet running, with great features
txt: Quiet running, with great features

title: Very quiet operation. Cleans very well. Overall excellent product.
txt: Very quiet operation. Cleans very well. Overall excellent product.

title: Horrible Interior Design
txt:
We purchased this dishwasher because the sales rep said it was the top of the line for dishwashers and the most quiet. It cleans nicely, however the interior design is horribly constructed and makes NO sense. On the bottom row the plate slats are far too close together, not to mention you have them going in opposite directions as the other sections, they end up  impeding on each other.  You can't put a casserole dish in and if you do just be prepared that 1/2 your rack on the bottom will be used. The cutlery holder on the bottom also interferes with the direction of grids, yes you can push them down, but then it's basically empty space. On the second row, traditionally you have 1 row for bowls in the middle and 2 rows on each side for cups. Bosch has 2 rows for bowls, but when you set your cups on the outer side and then bowls, they grind next to each other- so again not useful or smart. 
Clearly the person who designed this never actually had to do dishes before. Regret this purchase, it's not an ideal and you spend more time washing dishes because of how much less you can actually fit.

title: outstanding
txt: Our new Bosch 500 series is well made and runs quietly. Dishes are cleaned completely and the third rack is very handy. Controls are handy on top of door. The dishes do come out dryer when using the rinse. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: When it arrived it looked like it was new the...
txt: When it arrived it looked like it was new the packaging and everything on the outside look proper but when I opened it up it was all wet inside like someone had used it before and it smelled kind of strange but I hooked it up anyway and it seems to be working fine so that's that

title: Quite cleaninf
txt: Very happy with our new dishwasher, very quite and dishes come out very clean.  Love how the door pops open at the end of the cycle to aid in venting and drying! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Overall, it’s what I expected.
txt: It's sleek, easy to install and has lots of nice features.  As most will mention, it isn't the best at getting the dishes dry.  Run it overnight and in the morning majority will be dry.  I recommend starting with emptying the bottom rack first, because some water can sit on top of cups or bowls depending on your dishes and their placement. Top rack is awesome, but I wouldn't put any utensils up there that are caked with food particles.  Once you learn how to load it, it fits quite a bit.  And the adjustable rack allows for more creativity while loading.   The red floor light showing you its running is cool.  I feel happy with my upgrade. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher!

It seems no matter how full I stuff it with dishes everything comes clean (except the occasional item with too much baked on food because I don't run it on heavy). It's audible for the first 20 minutes or so, with a few squeaking noises and water whooshing noises, but after that it's almost completely silent. I also love the auto air feature for saving energy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Unbelievably Quiet
txt: So quiet, my brother in law and i both wondered if we had actually hooked up the water. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 44 dBA is library quiet!
txt: We LOVE our new Bosch dishwasher. While we didn't opt for the top of the line model, this one is amazingly quiet and incredibly effective. Dishes are spotless after every wash. Some may scoff at the price of this unit, but I want to be one to tell those people that it is worth every extra penny. Having owned several other brand dishwashers in the past 25 years, I can truly say that hands-down, this is the best unit I've ever owned. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very Solid Choice
txt:
I'm very happy with this dishwasher. It cleans most dishes the first time without having to scrub them, it's quiet, and I love the auto air feature which pops the door open at the end of the cycle allowing the dishes to air dry and cool off. Looks nice, very quite, I'm confident it will be the right choice for years to come.

I don't have any problems but do have two concerns that might be a problem for others. First, the drawers feel a little flimsy at times. Not sure if it will ever actually be an issue but if I was in the habit of loading a lot of heavy dishes all the time I bet they'll wear out quickly. Second issue is due to the 3rd rack and how organized the tines are it seems to have slightly less capacity than our old washer. That's not a problem for us and it's so easy to use with almost no prewashing required we could run it several times a day if needed. But if you have a large family it could be a problem. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing
txt: I didn't want to give a 4 but a 4.9 would be most accurate!  I wish the system would auto shut off when the cycle is done.   I love this dishwasher though, you don't have to preclean before putting dishes in and it holds EVERYTHING! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Wife loves it

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: The Bosch series runs quieter than our previous dishwasher. However, the Bosch does not have a heater and uses steam to dry which is not a feature i am liking. Also, I would prefer to have more of a visual on the control panel as to when the unit is running. Overall it gets the job done. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: A well-done dishwasher
txt:
I researched dishwashers extensively online before deciding on Bosch.  Donald Trump there were so many models to choose from that it was difficult to zero in on the one that was right for me.  I decided on the series 500 as it seemed to have all the features that I could ask for without having to pay more for extras that would not need.
The most impressive feature of this washer is how much cleaner the glasses and dishes come out.  My wife noticed it right away and she is the expert.  My favorite feature is that it is so quiet it can run at any time I never disturb my peace and quiet.  Our last washer would need to be put on a late night timer setting so as not to disturb. From the three rack design, multiple cycle selections, in - use floor lamp and smooth rack adjustability, this unit meets all my expectations.

title: Best dishwasher I’ve owned

Highly recommended! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The dishwasher itself is fantastic - but no one at...
txt: The dishwasher itself is fantastic - but no one at Home Depot, and nowhere on the Home Depot website, tells you that IT DOESN'T COME WITH A POWER CORD. You have to purchase it separately, so our dishwasher sat in the middle of the kitchen for a week. Imagine buying a toaster that didn't come with a cord, or a hair dryer. This is a thousand dollar dishwasher. It's obscene. And the salesman didn't know. And the website doesn't tell you when you order. Ridiculous.

title: MONTH 3: STINKS TO HIGH HEAVEN
txt: So disappointed to read all the online negative reviews about stinky Bosch dishwashers (try googling it yourself) after trying to find the cause of this horrific smell with only two months of use! After cleaning the filter (a disgusting job, wear gloves), there is still a rancid odor that won't go away, even after several very hot washes. There is also a standing pool of (dirty, I assume) water standing underneath the filter at all times. Who designed this? I never had to clean filters or run vinegar or baking soda through all the other dishwashers I have owned. Disappointed in this very expensive dishwasher. Would gladly trade for a Maytag or KitchenAid.

title: Best Dishwasher Ever

title: Love my Bosch 500 series dishwasher!

title: Crazy quiet. Washes well. Actually love third rack silverware which...

Again- it feels safer than having some capped wires a foot from the water inlet valve underneath my 10 year old Kitchen aide. The capacity seems a wee bit smaller on the lower rack but I don’t mind. If you, like me, have repaired and replaced parts and rewashed/ hand washed the glasses repeatedly from your ten year old d/w, trust me this is worth the $$. In nearly every load we do, there are items that have to be rewashed or handwashed because they are still dirty. We also do not like the racks, which make it difficult to stack the dishes in them. We have a Bosch clothes dryer that has been a real workhorse, but I could not recommend Bosch dishwashers after our experience with this one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I've had this for about a month and I have no real complaints about it. It's a dishwasher, it's n...
txt: I've had this for about a month and I have no real complaints about it. It's a dishwasher, it's not as quiet as the previous one I had. I find that most of the noise happens on starting it and also depending on how full the dishwasher is. It's louder with less things in it, you hear a lot of water sloshing around. When it is quiet I like being able to see that it's running with the red light that shines on the floor. The top rack is definitely something to get used to, glad that I looked at the booklet showing how to load it. This does what it should: gets the dishes sparkly clean. I haven't noticed any bad smells from it like previous reviewers.

txt: We replaced our 20-year-old white appliances to upgrade to stainless steel.  Our refrigerator, stove and microwave were all great additions. However, the Bosch dishwasher was the best of all. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good Purchase
txt: I am very pleased with the performance of the Bosch 500 Series Dishwasher.  I do not hear it running at all.  I would recommend a little more slant on the middle shelf.  Items tend to hold water upon completion.  It does an excellent job cleaning dishes.  Just a slight rinse before loading [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: $1000 and it neither cleans well nor drys
txt:
The Bosch dishwashers uses a condensation drying process.  In other words, THERE IS NO HEATING ELEMENT!  We were excited to invest in what we thought was a quality product with numerous reviews and make washing dishes by hand a thing of the past.  We were sadly, disappointed.

The good: Looks to be a nice unit.  It is quiet.

The bad: Cleaning can be hit or miss.  We pre-rinse heavy dirt from our dishes to reduce re-deposit, but still, often dishes are taken out and need to be re cleaned by hand.  Further, dishes are always wet.  We contacted Bosch and expressed out disappointment and they found that we follow all best practices.  Jet-Dry and tablet dishwasher soap is used that comes with the product in sample form.  They suggested a technician come out to check out the unit.  The tech found one of the blade arms was narrow and widened it.  Cleaning was a bit better but still hit or miss.  Drying was still abysmal and dishes continued to have a mildew oder.  I've owned dishwashers at half the cost of this unit that worked far better in terms of cleaning and actually left dishes dry.  This is all remarkably shocking as we read many reviews declaring this dishwasher one of the best at cleaning AND drying.  Perhaps we got that one problematic unit that happens from time to time, but Bosch has refused to refund our money.  We really just wanted a good dishwasher and were willing to spend the money to get a good one.  Sadly, the Bosch 500 did not deliver.

title: **Beware of delivery & installation in New Jersey.** I know this is not the forum to comment on ...
txt:
**Beware of delivery & installation in New Jersey.** 
I know this is not the forum to comment on such things but I cannot find another place to do so. The dishwasher itself seems to be pretty amazing -- based on the "test" while the installers were here, it is so quiet you can hardly tell it's running. The traditional top rack is so easy to pull out and push in that it may take some getting used to (to avoid overdoing it). 

The delivery/installation experience has been nothing short of AWFUL. Buyer beware. We were given a 4 hour installation window, and the installers showed up nearly 3 hours AFTER the expiration of the window. They first argued with me that it was impossible to remove our previous dishwasher as the kitchen cabinets must have been built after it was installed, however we know this was not the case as we were the ones who had the previous dishwasher installed after we bought the house -- and with the existing kitchen cabinets already in place. When they finally relented in their complaining, they pulled the old dishwasher out so hard that it broke part of our cabinet. They could not have seemed less interested in what they were doing. Once the new one was installed, they demonstrated for us that it was working (meaning turned on and not leaking), and were on their way. It was only when we went to actually use it the first time that we discovered that they never actually "anchored" it to anything -- when we open the door and pull out the bottom rack, the dishwasher fell forward out of the opening. It is literally just sitting on its legs and attached to nothing! I called 3 times to try to get this fixed (getting to the right area was a bit challenging), and the "best" they could finally do was to send a crew out a full week after the original installation. Very, very disappointing. Had we known it would be like this, we would have never purchased this dishwasher from Home Depot. We will never purchase another appliance from Home Depot given this absurd installation experience.

We replaced our 12 year-old Bosch with this model. The old one still worked, but was so covered in scale that it was on its last legs - I'll use rinse agent from here forward. 

The drawers on the new unit are much better suited to our tableware in all respects. We're getting used to the 3rd drawer - we find we get back the extra time spent loading it when we unload, and it does free up space for a larger load overall. 

Quality of cleaning is excellent. If we can get 12+ years out of this new dishwasher, we'll be happy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Absolutely convinced I made the right choice, other than now...
txt: Absolutely convinced I made the right choice, other than now my wife keeps looking for excuses to run it. A red dot illuminates on the floor when it's running, otherwise we wouldn't know it's operating. One fun feature is you can program it to partially open once the cycle is completed, thereby releasing the moist hot air trapped inside, but I'll wait until summer is over to activate it. Easily the best dishwasher we've ever owned. One caveat: If you're installing it yourself, be aware that it requires some interesting modifications. For instance, the water line attaches in the right rear rather than the left front, and if you're hard-wiring, you'll need the optional terminal adapter. Current You-Tube videos don't apply. The bottom is somewhat sealed. It can be a tight fit, but it WILL fit. Absolutely order the recommended accessories, you'll need them. You'll want to familiarize yourself with the installation process before you try. But once it's installed, you'll love it.

title: Excellent dishwasher
txt: I am most pleased with my new Bosch dishwasher, it’s quite operation, it’s sleek appearance and it’s spacious interior. I wish the digital timer was standard on all the dishwashers. I thought it was and thought there was a problem with mine because the digital display wasn’t lighted during operation. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very Impressed With Quality and Features
txt: Our old dishwasher bit the dust and it wasnt worth the cost to repair.  We bought this dishwasher as everyone has raved about Bosch Dishwashers.   This one stood out as I liked the third rack for the utensils.  I was a little worried but they have all been coming out spotless.  I also liked the adjustable second rack as well as the adjustable third rack to work for some bigger utensils as it can drop down slightly to give more room.  Also a nice feature is the door that holds the soap slides open and closed.  This is nice compared to the flip up ones as where it is placed it cant really be blocked from opening.  I love the autoair and open when done feature.  Also it is so quiet that you wouldn't know its running without the red light projected on the groud.  I instaled it myself and it was pretty straight forward and pretty darn easy.  I had to add the extra direct power line box as my dishwasher was hard wired but it was a piece of cake.  The only thing I did not like was the instructions on install around the little tabs to connect the dishwasher to the top of counter or side of cabients.  The little pictures didnt make much sense to me but I figured it out.     Outside of that it was easy to install, cleans the dishes great, is quite, and ill be looking to bosch for other appliacnes as needed.  I used to by a Samsung and LG guy but this really changed my mind.  In fact, even the delivery guys raved about it.  Looking forward to many years of use. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher review
txt: The BEST dishwasher I have ever owned!   Super quiet and really cleans the dishes [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet and cleans well
txt: I bought this dishwasher to replace a GE Profile that came with the new house.  I bought it on the recommendation of the Home Depot appliance salesperson.   This unit is amazingly quiet.  If not for the red light shining on the floor, I wouldn't know it was the on.  The dishes come clean even with caked on sauces and food.   It took some time to get the setting right for drying.  There is no heating coil inside the unit and it dries differently than most "American" units.   Once you get used to that and find the right setting, you will love this machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher

It holds a lot of dishes and is very quiet. My only compliant is that every time I fill the rinse agent,  it runs over the side. And the rinse agent is supposed to last for several washings, but I have to fill it each time. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet - solid performer
txt: This is a solid performing dishwasher. We find it works best using the recommended detergent pods and rinse agent. This is our second Bosch (second home) and we replaced a 2 year old GE that was broke more than it worked. Thank you Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Four dishwashers in ten years
txt: This dishwasher cleans incredibly well. It runs virtually silently. I have a lot of hope for its longevity as this is our fourth dishwasher in ten years, but our first Bosch. Granted, we are a family of ten and often run the dishwasher twice a day. I was initially pleased with the cleaning power of each of the three non-Bosch dishwasher, but the cleaning power of this Bosch is unlike anything I have seen before. It is really impressive and I highly recommend it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We are very happy with this dishwasher.  The dishes...
txt: We are very happy with this dishwasher.  The dishes are coming out very clean and are dried completely.  It runs so quietly that you need to check for an indicator light on the floor to see if it is on before opening it.  The quick wash cycle seems to work very well if the load is not too soiled.  My only negative comment would be about the height of the 2nd shelf.  You do need to watch it and cannot put some of the taller cups up there because they hit the third row tray (for larger utensils etc).  You also can only put lower profile utensils up there on the third row tray - a large ladle would get caught on the top.

title: My new Bosch
txt: This purchase is my third Bosch dishwasher. It replaces one that was over 15 years old.  I sure miss the 28 minute cycle on the old one. My dishes are just as clean, but the shorter cycle was convenient.  I will need some time to adjust to the set up of these racks. If this model lasts near as long as the one it replaced it will be a Good investment. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I am sorely disappointed with this expensive dishwasher!!  The racks are so incompatible with a n...
txt: I am sorely disappointed with this expensive dishwasher!!  The racks are so incompatible with a normal load of my dishes.  Seems like they tried to make them so fancy that they are no longer practical.  I finally got some rinse aid today and hope that helps with drying, but I can't believe how much moisture remains after a cycle.  And TOTALLY can't believe it takes almost 3 hours to run!!  But it seems like that is rather common in lots of dishwashers now, not just this one.  REALLY wish my KitchenAid hadn't given up on me.... I loved that dishwasher!!

title: A quiet dishwasher
txt:
We purchased the 500 series Bosch dishwasher because because of its quiet operation.  It is well insulated, has stainless interior and lives up to its quiet operation reputation. I give it 4/5 because of the installation, not the operation.

There are two issues to be aware of when installing. 1. Unlike many dishwashers which are hard wired, the Bosch dishwashers require a special outlet/ junction box that is sold separately and can be a challenge to locate since it is a specialized part.
2. A critical point in the water connection is where the water line connects to the dishwasher.  There are clear warnings about cross threading the connection, but this critical component is made out of plastic and can be difficult to allign properly. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Product
txt:
After our old dishwasher broke, I was looking for something that would last from constant running of my 7 person household, and this came recommended from a co-worker.  

First impressions are that it is a great dishwasher.  Lots of useful features, but my favorites are 1) It is VERY quiet.  I wasn't even sure it was on when I first started using it.  2) The auto air feature which opens the dishwasher after it is done.

The only thing I can't comment on at this point is how robust it is.  I am running it probably 3 times every 2 days, and I hope it outlasts the 5 year warranty I have on it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Series Dishwasher
txt:
The size is just perfect for us with it being built-in, designed to fit seamlessly in our kitchen counter. 
The cycle options are just fantastic with a variety of cycles for our needs. The racks can allow us to fit bigger plates in the bottom or taller glasses up top. The control panel we really like is located on the top of the door as “fully integrated.”
We have a young son that likes to push buttons so these are hidden away at the top of the door. Our dishwasher is so quiet running I really have to make sure it is running by looking on the ground for the red light to make sure it's on. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Silent and sweet

title: Awesome Doshwasher

title: Quiet and convenient
txt:
It's quiet.  So quiet that you aren't always sure it's even on, so there's a little light shining on the floor to tell you it's running.  If you're in the same room, you can hear when it's filling, and sometimes you can hear the spray hitting pots and the like.  But compared to most other dishwashers, it may as well be a mime.

The drawers are a little unusual.  Loading tall glasses can be troublesome sometimes, especially if you also have tall things in the bottom.  But the third tray for silverware and shallow things is super handy.

The best feature, however, is something it lacks.  There is no traditional heating element at the bottom of the unit.  That means that you can put anything anywhere it'll fit.  No more having to leave glasses out because you need to wash some plastics.  Everything can go everywhere.  The trade-off is that it is much slower than other units.  An auto cycle with air-dry (a nifty feature that pops the door open a few inches to let steam out when it's done) runs just shy of 3 hours.  There are quick-wash cycles, but I haven't messed with those. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Our New Dishwasher
txt: This is the best dishwasher ever.  We did a lot of comparison shopping and reviews before we made the buy.  This was by far the best one out there, but you can never be so sure.  Well let me tell you they were correct.  My dishes all look fantastic each and every time we take them out.  The last dishwasher we had to wash them before we put them in.  Not with this one.  The old one also did not do a very good job of drying the dishes.  Very little wetness at all with the new one.  Only a bit is left on the coffee cups that have indents in the bases were the water sits.  This dishwasher is also so very quiet.  Sometimes my husband & I have to come back into the kitchen to make sure one of us started it.  This is the best dishwasher on the market.  That 3rd rack for silverware is the best idea every. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

During my extensive research or reviews, I found no better company than Bosch for overall quality.  My search lead me to the 500 series which was stated to have the best overall value in price, satisfaction, quality and realiability.  So far I am content with the purchase.  This machine is so quiet that if it wasn't for the convenient red light indicator, I would not know that it was running.  The sleek design and no logo allows my dishwasher to match the rest of our non-Bosch appliances.  The 3rd rack comes in handy with all our bulky utensils such as our grilling equipment.  The only gripe I have, which seems to be common is, items place on the upper racks, especially plastic, do not dry as much as we hoped for.  Other than that, I don't think we could've maid a better selection. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet, but troublesome start
txt: I have had this dishwasher for about 4 weeks, and it has successfully completed 3 cycles. The repairman came out after the first failure, and thought it was a faulty control board. Waited for a week to get a new board, and an appointment to come to the house and install it. He then determined that the door latched sensor was flaky, and would randomly indicate unlatched status on the door, which stops the cycle. He has ordered a new latch assembly and stronger door closing springs to see if that will fix it. The dishwasher does clean very well, and is extremely quiet when it runs. I hope to get years of uninterrupted service from this machine once it is fixed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I want my old Whirlpool dishwasher back!
txt: I feel ripped off.  This is supposed to be quiet and it is everything but quiet.  My old whirlpool dishwasher was so much quieter.  I never heard water sloshing and banging like the propeller arm is hitting something constantly, when there is nothing in the way.  It's just loud.  It reads 50 decibles and it's irritating to me that my sever year old dishwasher was so much quieter.  I really wanter to return it, but the turn around time for dishwashers right now is two weeks out or more to one installed.  There is simply no one available, but t plumber who wants to charge $400 for a basic install.  I am hoping it's just defective and they will have to replace the whole unit on their own dollar.  I am utterly disappointed in the lack of quality, ranging from poor coverage toe kick panel (23.5" on a 24" dishwasher). leaving gaps at side on bottom.  Total waste of money.  Saving for a new one already and won't be buying a service plan.  Be glad to have it gone in a year if this is what it is supposed to be like.

The downside:  every so often I'll walk by and see the red light on the ground flashing.  I open the door, and have no idea why the machine stopped mid-cycle.  No error code, so I have to figure it out myself??  I hit the start again, it starts working again. WHY???  I paid for a top of the line brand and could've gotten the same reliability at a quarter of the price. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Some pros, some cons
txt:
After a couple of month's use, here's where I'm at with it.

Pros
- Quiet. This was a factor in my purchase.
- Red LED light projected onto floor. If it weren't for the red LED spot on the floor, I often would not know it's running. 
- Seems to clean OK in the lower and middle racks.
- The feature to pop-open the door after the cycle is complete is nice. It was a selling feature since I've heard that Bosch dishwashers do not dry very well. 
- Adjustable dish and glass support tines and features. So far I fold most of these out of the way, but I know they are there if needed.
- Center rack height can be adjusted to three different heights. 
- Top silverware rack has adjustable tines and outer sections, and can be removed to fit taller items in the lower rack.
- The soap dispenser fits the Kirkland-brand detergent packets.
- Easy to DIY install. The instructions are good.

Cons
- Does not dry as well as my prior 17 year old washer. I think the feature that pops the door open helps. I was under the impression that these dishwashers use heat for drying, but there is no visible heating element in the bottom. Conversely, the fact that there is no heating element in the bottom probably means that plastics can be washed on the bottom rack.
- Spacing of the dish support tines is awkward. The plate tines are so close together that only plates and thin items can be used there. Thin baking pans (1" deep sheet pans) do not fit. The tines in the space for larger items are not aligned on the left and right sides, even when the optional tines are folded down, meaning that you cannot fit quarter-sheet pans across some sections. At best I can get three to fit, spaced farther apart than necessary, yet not far enough to fit something else between.
- This model does not have the two-piece utensil basket for the bottom. I think Bosch should include the two-piece utensil basket for all models (why keep separate inventory?), but especially for all models that have the third rack for flatware. Because of the third rack for flatware, I never need all of the full-sized utensile basket so it would be nice to reclaim that space for dishes.
- Very long cycle times compared to my prior dishwasher. 
- The stainless steel is not fingerprint resistant. This means every touch will be recorded on the surface until cleaned, and it is difficult to achieve a streak-free look when cleaning. I have found that a final clean with Windex followed by a dry paper towel gets the job done, but it takes some patience. My recommendation is to consider another color. I should have opted for black. I wonder if a company that does car wraps could cover a dishwasher with a very thin clear film? Hmmm....
- The red LED "on" indicator that projects onto the floor is helpful, but I wish Bosch would put the time-remaing indicator in all models that have hidden door-top controls.

Would I recommend this? Yes. But I would also suggest considering a model with better drying, less limiting tine arrangments, and the two-piece utensile basket (especially with the dedicated flatware rack).

Ken [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 Series Dishwasher-ROCKS
txt:
We've had our new dishwasher about a month now. I thought I would seriously miss having a heating element to help with drying the dishes. Turns out, the dishes are completely dry without it. There are always the spots that don't dry like the lip on bottom of cups and plastic storage containers, but everything else is dry. 
I love my dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: After a few tries, this Bosch dishwasher is truly fantastic! Gets everything clean in one try and the storage flexibility is wonderful. Recommend this! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: LOVE MY BOSCH DISHWASHER!
txt: This is the 3rd dishwasher we have owned and there is no comparison of the first two to the quality of the Bosch. It is so unbelievably quiet and extremely well made. Love the high end appearance. My husband doesn't usually comment on appliances, but he loves it too. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great cleaning - but
txt: We bought this dishwasher upon recommendation of friends and love that the dishes come out very clean....no spots.  Only problem is if we don't run it at least every 2 days, by day 3 it gets a funky odor like garbage.  We always rinse the dishes, so there's no caked on food to smell this bad.  It happens all the time.  We use lemi-clean with the dish soap to help sanitize, which was recommended by our installer, but if it's left without running for 3 days, back comes the smell. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best ever!
txt: We just love our Bosch dishwasher. It's so quiet & does an amazing job cleaning the dishes!

title: Nice
txt: Nice looking and does the job as described. It is quite (44 dBA), though not as quite as I was expecting. I would have spent extra money to get a quiter (40 dBA) version. I have an open floor plan so when I watch TV I did not want to hear the dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: !!** HIGHLY RECOMMENDED  **!!
txt: Quiet , quiet, QUIET! ... this dishwasher is so quiet.  Our friends couldn't believe the Bosch DW was on while we talked in the kitchen (using physical distancing of course).  It has a sleek, utilitarian look that matches our decor and other appliances.  It is easy to operate, easy to clean and impeccably performs its duties.  We've used Bosch dishwashers for the last 15 years and couldn't be more pleased! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet, competent dishwasher
txt: This is our first Bosch appliance after researching Consumer Reports and questioning the repairman of our previous dishwasher. This unit doesn't disappoint. It is so quiet you don't know it is on. A red light projects on the floor to signal it is on and this is helpful. Dishes come out clean and dry. The door of this unit opens automatically at the end of the wash which helps ensure dishes are dry. Only bother here is how long the wash cycle lasts (3hr, 14min), but I haven't yet tried the 60min cycle. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I do not use the 3rd top rack nor the utensil insert because it is too long & I don't need that much room for my forks etc. I use the one from my previous dw. I am glad we purchased this dw.

title: Best appliance purchase
txt: When the technician brought the new dishwasher into the house, he needed a dolly to bring it in. When he took the old one out he carried it with no problem and no dolly was needed. The old one made out of plastics and no insulation. The new Bosch one was solid and had insulation. They told me that the machine projected a red light on the floor to tell it's on. That blew me away. The machine is so quiet. I was expecting to hear a little noise but nothing. My wife and I are so happy we made this purchase. It is probably the best purchase we have made so far. Hands down the best dishwasher we have owned. Thank you Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

After my dishwasher was installed I then discovered how effective the pull out drawer for silverware or any small item.  Usually those items do not get cleaned in my many other brands I have used.  It even cleans the cake decorating tips!  But when its running you have to check the floor for the red light to make sure it's running! Yes!!! Its that quite.  I will never use another brand again so goodby to all the noisy dishwasher brands that I have used in the past.  Thank you to the makers of BOSH [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: you won't regret it
txt: We bought this dishwasher to upgrade the one that came with our new construction home because we had a simialr model Bosch in our previous home.  Once you have it installed, and are using it on a daily basis, you will never miss those extra $$ that you spent to get a Bosch.  It is so quiet that you will have to check to see if the light is on to know whether it is running.  The third rack for silverware and small items makes so much sense, and keeps each piece separate from the others so they get clean.  We tested to 60 minute cycle with a bunch of dishes that we did not rinse and had food dried on them.  No problem.  They all came out clean.  This machine makes your life easier. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love it!

title: Beyond clean - it's Q-U-I-E-T
txt:
In the market for a new dishwaster?  This is it!  Super clean dishes are standard with the added plus of a very small sound print.  Our kitchen is next to our main living area and now we can hear without the rotating splashing sound of the dishwasher doing its thing.  
I'm not just talking quiet, this is an amazing drop in sound level.  This is a WOW clean machine.  Sleek and slick wrapped in the sound of silence.  Here's to Simon, Garfunkle and Bosch - "Echo the sound of silence" [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher

You can't even tell it's running except for the red dot on the floor which lets you know it's on. I can put it on while we have dinner and you'd never know it was actively washing the dishes. After the cycle, there appears to be an unpleasant odor coming from the dishwasher.  I have regularly checked the trap at the botton of the tray & it is clean.  I hope you can offer me a solution.

title: We love our Bosch. It is so very quiet and...
txt: We love our Bosch. It is so very quiet and easy to operate. The online user manual is much better than the included manual. Specifically, the online manual provides a much more extensive listing of customizable codes. Very nice unit and extremely easy to install.

title: This dishwasher was purchased after research and its availability, being manufactured in the USA....
txt: This dishwasher was purchased after research and its availability, being manufactured in the USA. I used it twice, and it was indeed quiet and cleaned the dishes, silverware, and glassware very well. The third time I loaded it, it would not start, and the "active" light blinked. I reset the error, and cycled power. No luck. I have called Bosch Customer support, and they gave me the numbers of local repair shops. I called, and the fastest appointment available was July 8 (called on June 28). Apparently, there is an issue with the door latch, but until it is repaired, I won't know for sure. I hope that this unit will give 18 years of great service like the unit that it replaced.

title: Bosch greatfully replaced Whirlpool
txt: Our 4½ year old high-end Whirlpool dishwasher has had several home repair visits.  This time it was the electronics board.  I said not anohter dime goes into the WP.  We searched for the Consumer Report's highest rated DW.  This new Bosch is so quiet, we have to look at the floor for it red led showing it's running.  We can also fit more items in this Bosch than with the WP... and the latter sounded like a freight train passing.  The WP kept us awake at night running.  This was one of my smartest moves since our high-dollar kitchen remodel 4½ years ago.  Had a quick question on the install and Customer Service was extremely helpful AND very friendly... I didn't have to wait but a couple of seconds for help either. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 Series Dishwasher

title: Not as Good
txt: Our last three dishwashers have been Bosch. The previous two have been excellent in terms of performance and design. The latest is disappointing. It isn't noticeably more quiet than the last. My greatest complaint is the toddler setting--that can't be overridden--that requires one to hit the Start button again every time the door is opened after programming. Since there is no longer a front-facing display to let users know if the dishwasher is on or programmed to run later, I have to stick a note on the front each night to warn my family that the dishwasher is on.  This is a serious design fail. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Happy Owner

title: Cleans great but sucks to load
txt: I love the way my Bosch 500 cleans. I love how quiet it runs.  The functions and the way it looks in my kitchen are wonderful.  But it don't get nearly as many dishes in the washer as my old appliance, particularly the second rack where our glasses go.  The way the tynes are placed and slanted and the many changes in the level of the rack (not including being able to raise it to 3 heights), leaves us with 20% less space.  I would love to give this unit 5 stars, as it checks off most every box when it comes to features, function, and asthetics. But the way the rack tynes are situated make it difficult to give that extra star.  It is the Achilles heal if this machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean
txt: I've had a Bosch in the past and got an L_ replacement after an electrial storm hit my home.  What a mistake but now we are back with Bosch and can notice an extreme improvement to our wash cycles.  Quiet, easy to install and in general a quality product.  You should buy the water line kit to connect to the unit and be prepaired that the electrial is a plug, similar to what desk top computers use.  Very nice improvement. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: great experience with previous model
txt:
I had traditional dish washer which was making lots of noise when your turn it on. Even, I always start the dishwasher overnight and noise was waking me up.

I saw Bosch models in dishwasher aisle and read all of features ..etc. I bought SHP65T55UC (Bosch-500) in 2016. I believe this one is exactly same as mine but this is new generation. Mine is still working great.

What did I need?
1- Quick wash (less than 1hr)
2- Quietness (44dB is great)
3- hidden buttons (because of kids)
4- invisible heating coil. ( i had bad experience with visible heating core, spoon dropped on it and entire interior of machine melted down)
5- stainless steel inside ( no discoloring and making smell like plastic one)
6- delayed start. 

Did I get any trouble with machine, 
Yes, I did.
1- I paid extra and bought 2 years extra warranty. A few months later warranty expired, heating core (i forgot the part name, it looks like a snail) failed. It was not drying the dishes. I have reached Bosch and ordered replacement part. It took about 25 min to replace it and it is working great.
2- It does not dry the dishes 100%. my solution is when it done (after beeping), I keep open the door little bit and steam comes out. 
3- makes smell from time to time. but it is not mold smell, I believe it is related with detergent. Because I have to use septic safe detergent. 
4- inside of the door has some scratch, because i do not push the racks all the way end and door pushes them and made scratch ( it is my fault..! :) )

Nothing is perfect. But, it works great for me. In laws called me about an hour ago for asking the model number of my bosch dishwasher. They are planning to buy new one, especially quiet one. I recommended them bosch.

It does a great job cleaning dishes, glasses and pots and pans.  I like the silverware rack.  I am still learning to efficiently use the top rack and get glasses and smaller plates or plasticware in as I had in my previous diswasher.  I am very happy with this washer and would recommend it highly. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet, efficient and cleanest dishwasher I have ev
txt:
We replaced our old dishwasher with a Bosch when the old one bit the dust. We researched Consumer Reports and did a brief survey of friends with dishwashers, and no one had anything bad to say about Bosch.

Our experience has been nothing but spectacular. Installation was well documented, and as it was a replacement, it definitely was no problem. It is whisper quiet - so much so that our kids have opened it several times while it was running, oblivious to that fact.

The layout is spacious and adjustable. It cleans spectacularly, and we have run it at least four times a week, so it is well used to this point with no issues. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

It seems to hold a lot more than the one we replaced even though they are the same size. It is very sleek and modern looking. The stainless steel is is easy to clean with stainless steel cleaner. The only two things that are a negative about it is 1) the cycles are very long. A normal cycle takes about 2 1/2 hours.(Honestly, I am still uses to my old one from the 90's that would run through and be finished in about 30-45 mins. Not really a problem with the dishwasher, I am just not used to it yet). 2) It seems to have a slight smell when I open it. It is nothing that is very strong or overpowering. I can really only smell it when I lean down to put something in it when the door is open. It just smells like a collection of dirty dishes. Overall, I would definitely recommend this dishwasher for people who are looking to upgrade. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: No smells, quiet, cleans PB, no melting plastic
txt: After 3 months it is time to write a review. First off, there are NO SMELLS emanating from the interior. I had read reviews with complaints of smells. I could not discern if the smell complaints were due to plastic interior, or reviewers wanting to tarnish Bosch’s reputation, as they all had same writing style. I had plastic interior DWs in past and never had smells. I have wanted Bosch appliances since 1970s, but believed they were too expensive. Kept purchasing more reasonably priced appliances such as GE, Kenmore, Frigidaire and Whirlpool. I did spring for an Amana fridge once. Decided after my last DW, a highly rated Consumers Reports Whirlpool that died at 3 year and 7 months, to go with a brand with great reliability. Fixing the Whirlpool DW would cost more than to replace as the heating element and the control panel were both shot. It did not make it to 7 years like my previous Kenmore. Then, in my research I learned appliances in the past 5 years have not been manufactured as they once were, more plastic parts to break and enclosed parts that no repair person could access. So, even if purchase another Kenmore probably won’t last as long. This Bosch DW is a similar model a relative has loved for 4 years, so with this recommendation I should like this as well. Having an enclosed heating element is great, no dishwasher safe plastic melts, even on the bottom rack. The stainless steel interior is nice looking and should not get cracks like a plastic interior. The racks configure nicely, can get all my assorted sizes of dishes, pans, drinkware positioned. This is the 1st DW I ever owned (and that is many years) that gets peanut butter off the butter knives, and any plates it is on. So quiet I cannot tell it is running, doesn’t interfere with TV in adjacent room (no walls between rooms). Drying cycle gets all dry except drinkware with indentations on top that water pools in. That is fine, easy to dry off those cups. I keep the door open about 3” so interior that might be wet after a wash, or dirty items will dry out and not form mold. My relative with a Bosch DW told me she never keeps door open, closes it completely and never had problems with mold and smells in 4 years. Still, I like to be sure everything dries. I have been keeping DW doors and washing machine doors open for years to dry out interiors and never had mold or smells. The DW drain basket and spray arms are easy to get at to clean if needed. Mine have not been dirty/clogged. I expect this DW to make it past 5 years (based on friends and relatives experiences), hope it gets to 7. I am going to post this same review on the Lowe’s site (store where I purchased) so more consumers can learn of this good product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Satisfied Bosch Customer
txt: Purchased this dishwasher after exhaustive research and recommendations. Installed myself, no problems at all. Dishwasher comes with everything you need to install it safely and effectively. Really doesn't matter what the condition of the dishes were when they were loaded, this dishwasher gets the job done. Best of all, it is so quiet. Like so quiet they have included a subtle light at the base that shines on the floor to let you know it is on. It is really hard to tell otherwise. Super happy with this purchase and product. Highly recommended. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher
txt: We recently downsized and our new home has an open concept.  It was very important to have a quiet efficient dishwasher.  After much research we decided on our Bosch dishwasher!  So far it has met all our expectations - we wouldn't even know it was on if it wasn't for the red light that shines on the floor. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Wife Is Very Happy
txt:
I don't always do everything right, but I managed to get this right. When we were looking to replace our 15 year old dishwasher, I found this one. After reading reviews, reading test results published by a consumer product testing organization, and speaking to happy Bosch dishwasher owners, there was no doubt which brand we were going to buy. The quality of the appliance was obvious as we shopped and inspected the other brands available. 

We decided on this model because of the features and appearance. I enjoy watching my wife load the dishwasher because she actually smiles like it is fun. She is also pleased with the washcycle options available. The air dry feature has worked great for our needs. And, we use the rinse liquid which has resulted in dishes, glasses and other items free of spots and other water marks. 

The install was easy, but I have previously installed dishwashers. The past experience helped and made me appreciate the Bosch appliance even more. The power cord, water line and drain were straight forward. I needed to level it in the space and found that to be a simple process. 

We were a bit concerned about the need to clean out a filter. None of our other dishwashers had this feature. But the process is simple and I like knowing the drain path is clear. We keep the garbage disposal drain free of food parts and pieces, which is a good idea always.

The more we use the dishwasher the more we personally find why this brand is consistently rated so high. My daughter is intentionally finding problems with her brand dishwasher (which still works) so she can justify buying a Bosch. She'll have one soon I'm sure. 

Anyways, I highly recommend this dishwasher. So far so great. Plus my wife is very happy. For me that's the best part. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Happy to have made the switch!
txt: We were lookig for a mid-price range quality dishwasher to be an upgrade to our prior unit. Several friends and relatives recommened we go with Bosch. We knew of their reputation for being quiet diswashers and found one with several other features that attracted us. The 3rd drawer at the top and  a setting that opens the door at the end of the cycle for even better drying sold us. We have had it for just over three months now and have been very pleased with its operation. The unit is very quiet, it has all of the features (and more) that we might want and, most importantly, our dishes come out  clean. We made an excellent choice going with Bosch! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Shpm65z55n
txt: After running my new dishwasher for a month I have to say honestly that I am not 100% satisfied. The one thing I find that it does not hold as much as my previous dishwasher and I don't think it cleans as well as my old dishwasher. I'm still trying to figure out the best setting to use but sometimes my dishes still come out with food on them even though I'm doing everything the correct way. Another issue I am having is that it seems to take a long time to do its cycles. I am very happy with how quiet it is and the look is perfect and it fits in nicely with the rest of my kitchen. It's still a learning curve for me but eventually I hope to find the best way to use it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher! - only wish space was better
txt:
This is the greatest dishwasher I've owned! (Never mind the fact that it's only the second one I've owned too) 
It is extremely quiet... the sound of the drain is actually the loudest part, and that's due to my garbage disposal cover not being on correctly. 
The dishes always come out spotless and clean. 
My only complaint (the fifth star in the review) is the space. I do like the three drawer idea as it keeps the silverware flat and tucked in the top, but what is the purpose of the side tray on the bottom drawer? You can't really put any spatulas or long mixing spoons as they prohibit the jet spinning thing to spin. So, I typically take it out and it gives me a few extra square inches for actual dishes. As for the height of the second drawer, I can't really put a standard size dinner plate in it without it hitting the top drawer. 
I feel like these are designed for European dishes...
All-in-all, I would absolutely recommend this dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great functionality in a high quality dishwasher!
txt:
replaced a 5 year old top model kitchenaid. We love the 3 racks with many modular adjustments that are quick and easy to do on the fly. Its is QUIET!! Thank God there is a little indicator light that shows up on the floor or else I would have no idea if it was running. Haha. Love that there is no exposed heating element in the bottom. Very clean and dries amazingly well. There are a lot of customizable settings that are all useful. The part i was most nervous about using was the auto pop open door. Once I saw how it worked I have zero fears and really like that it can pop open to vent and dry the dishes to perfection. It is a sprong loaded door so all it does is release the door and it pops open on its own. No moving push rods or anything which makes me confident in its durability. 

We are super happy with this purchase and have recommended it to allow our friends!! Do not hesitate to purchase this dishwasher!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Putting all our silverware on the top shelf saves so much room on the bottom shelf for larger items and overflow from the middle shelf. Not having a bottom heating element has saved me from hand washing larger plastic lids and cups. The adjustable middle shelf is also a plus. I can easily change it when needed. Customer service is also great. I had a question and they were very helpful! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: We are happy with the new Bosch 500 Dishwasher. However, the Air Dry feature, which is meant to open the door at the end of the cleaning cycle to allow air drying of the dishes, does not work.

title: Worth The Wait!
txt: We recently replaced a 20+ year old dishwasher that was so noisy I would only run it late at night.  I chose a Bosch dishwasher because of the customer reviews and our own experience with Bosch products.  I love the third rack for large utensils, knives etc.  Another great feature is the adjustable rack which makes loading large pots and pans much easier.  Perhaps the biggest bonus is how quiet this dishwasher is during use.  I highly recommend this product! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Incredible Dishwasher!
txt:
This Bosh replaced our 21 year old previous workhorse.  So far (2 months) we really love this dishwasher.  Great features with the 3rd rack.  The exterior has a clean, sleek, modern look & we like the controlls are hidden when closed.

The ONLY issue we have with it so far is that it is SO QUIET we forget it is running (even though the light is on the floor) & open it to put dishes in it.  Overall for 2 months it is well worth the money & we will certainly look at other Bosh appliances when it is time to purchase again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet and easy to install
txt: I really like how quiet the dishwasher is.  If the red light wasn't showing on the floor as an indicator it's running you'd have a hard time knowing it's running.  The third shelf is amazing for knives, spatulas, etc.  Doesn't dry quite as well as our old dishwasher but that's probably a trade off for efficiency.  We also like the adjustability of the racks. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very Disappointed
txt: I have had this dishwasher for about two weeks and feel I made a mistake in buying it for four reasons.  1). Because of the way the prongs are slanted on the middle and bottom rack, you are forced to place the dishes in a certain way/pattern, or they don't get clean. Bosch markets how great it is to be able to put in 16 place settings, but the reality is everyday use includes bowls, pans and pots that are not uniformly shaped. The prongs prevent some of these from being loaded in a way that will get them clean.  I was told the prongs are placed that way because the water flow is designed to only hit the dishes in a certain pattern.  The result is the number of items I can load are significantly less than all the previous dishwashers that had prongs that pointed straight up.  I now must hand wash items I would have normally put in the dishwasher because they can’t fit in properly to get clean unless they are the only thing on the rack. 2). Because of the third rack, taller glasses cannot fit on the second rack which is crazy because the second rack has a plastic piece that holds stemware in place.  This only works if you have really short stem glasses. If you have anything other than shorter glasses, they will not fit on the middle rack.  Small salad bowls and such do not fit well on that rack either because those prongs are slanted as well.  3). I feel mislead on the third rack.  Apparently, you cannot put anything in there that isn't perfectly flat because there is a spinning arm that shoots out water but we can't see it and if anything is there that is not flat, it gets caught on the spinning arm and those things don't get clean.  4). Lastly, if you don't use the Auto Air feature, your dishes come out sopping wet.  But to use the Auto Air feature, it takes 3 hours and 15 minutes to complete.  They are still wet but better than if you use the regular 2.5 hour cycle.  Also be sure to turn off the dishwasher after every use or the control panel stays on. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean machine
txt: Overall very happy with performance of machine. Installation instructions could have been more use friendly. At first it didn't work. Had to on on line to identify issue with bleeding the water supply line. Everything working now.

I also love the low profile front...Our dishes are cleaner than ever.  Love this dishwasher [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: We recently purchased our dishwasher after our old Bosch stopped working- After about 10 years of use. It was great so we decided to get another. I love the added rack in the top for silver wear or small items. Canning rings fit up there nicely. We will always buy Bosch. You can't beat the quality. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 500 Series Dishwasher
txt:
Like it real well after a problem during start up.  Apparently some water used during testing before shipment had drained somewhere it should not have been and got error message saying it was leaking and needed servicing.  I removed the clean out screen etc and reinstalled and error message disappeared and tried again and got same message and something was running in bottom of dishwasher.
Did the same again two more times and on the second attempt started as it should and been working great ever since.  Don't know if the washer was turned over during handling and let water go where it should not.  Some gurgled out of side opening on left side on the last attempt.  Since then all is great just getting used to new dish placement rack as replaced prior Bosch that I had for many years and did a great job.  Glassware doing great with rinse additive. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher ever
txt: I honestly cannot imagine that a better dishwasher exists, unless it loads and unloads dishes by itself. I have owned numerous high-end, pricey dishwashers over the years, but this machine, very reasonably priced, is by far the best I have ever had. I have never had dishes this clean, and we have intentionally put this machine to the test to find its limitations. So far, there don't seem to be any. It is whisper quiet in our open concept home, a necessity, and opens itself at the end of the cycle so that dishes are completely dry when I go to unload it. This is also a great feature to reduce potential for mold growth in the machine, another critical need for my family. Finally, the one selling point for me was the auto water leak sensor. This machine will never ruin your wood floors or flood your kitchen leading to a mold disaster. The entire machine sits in a huge pan that will catch any water leak and will automatically shut off the machine if water is detected. Brilliant design, and what peace of mind! Why aren't all dishwashers made this way? Because they are not Bosch. This machine far exceeds all of my expectations. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher

title: Excellent Dishwasher
txt: I installed our new Bosch 500 series dishwasher about a month ago and so far, we couldnt be happier. This dishwasher does an outstanding job of cleanding AND drying dishes. I was hesitant at first since these do not have a dedicated drying heating element, but my reservations were unfounded. I do love that we are able to run this at any time of day now as it is so quite! Our previous dishwasher (2000's Maytag) had to be run at night due to the high noise level. Unfortuanly ours did have a couple small scratches on the side of the door, but I was able to get a partial credit back from the vendor and I touched up with white paint. We did pay quite a bit more than other brands, so hopefully it will be reliable long term. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: wonderful
txt: There are so many options to make loading and unloading easier, no streaks on glassware or silver!  True that everything doesn't have to be pre washed.  This is a wonderful product. This is our third in this home. It is the best ever and very quiet.  Can't say enough good things about this product!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Designers need to change several features
txt: From all the reviews I have read on this dishwasher, I expected more. The first thing I noticed during installation was the plastic inlet valve hose attachment. My old one was brass and the water line easily threaded onto it. This plastic easily cross threads and is the number one complaint from the repair tech. The second issue, dishes never completely dry. Although the "benefit" is a higher efficiency washer to cover up the excuse of wet dishes. A heating element is really required. If you want to towel dry your dishes as you unload, this is your washer. The top rack is almost useless. It impedes the loading capability of the second rack and I have taken dirty utensils out after a wash cycle. Another quirk is that after a wash cycle ends and then upon opening the washer, the wash cycle automatically enables. You have to turn off the washer, when this should be the default. Who's going to immediately reload the washer and start it? Lastly, the bottom rack spacing for dishes seems to be off. If you load plates into the washer on either left or right sides, theres no room for plates to be placed side by side. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Awesome
txt: We replaced a 30 year old dishwasher with the Bosh 500, and it is like moving from the horse and buggy to the jet age. It took a little bit of time to learn how to operate it, but now that we have the hang of it we love this dishwasher. Everything comes out sparkling clean, and the feature that opens the door when the wash was done is really useful. So glad we decided to pay a little more for a quality machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet.

title: Okay dishwasher but not overly impressed
txt: It is not easy to put dishes in with the way it has the spikes which I've never experienced before. It's very quiet which is pleasant. It seems I must use some kind of extra rinse aid as I'm using a multi clean pod that has a rinse aid but I still get spots on silverware and dishes and that's just embarrassing when I think someone else might think they aren't clean. I like the LED on floor to tell me it's running but it's not super clear why sometimes I set controls and shut the door and the light is blinking instead of solid which means it isn't going to start so I have to reset and restart and I still get blinking light sometimes so that's annoying. Idk what's wrong but I got to mess with for a while and it's happened more than a few times since I've bought it in March, it's mid May now. Probably my inability to Tetris in my dishes and bowls very easily like I feel I could do in the past is the most annoying aspect so far. Glad I live alone. If I had more dishes or when the holidays come, I'm worried about that. I can adjust the prongs on bottom but I haven't messed with that. It's probably amazing and it's user error issues. I'm happy but not blown away. I'll be blown away if it's still working in 4 years. Definitely the one type of kitchen appliance that I have had to buy again and agian. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Truly disappointing
txt: I purchased this Bosch dishwasher in August to replace an older, adequate, but loud GE dishwasher.  Yes, it is sleek and much quieter, and as a highly rated brand, I was willing to spend more money.  Mistake.  At this point it hasn't been worth the cost.  The biggest issue is the filter system, as it needs to be cleaned every month or two in order to keep the pump emptying during the wash cycle.  Not a problem for the first four months, but now the lack of draining has happened three times over the past four months.  If it's not cleaned, the pump doesn't empty and has to be manually drained, filters cleaned and a small plastic part removed and replaced. This is not an easy process, you need to remove the bottom shelf, maneuver in the dish water to find the drain, and remove 1 delicate plastic piece that you have to use a spoon to pull out. This has to be repeated every time, sometimes more than twice if I want the dishwasher to function and my dishes to actually get cleaned. Bosch has been helpful with suggestions and now, the third time, has sent out a work order for a service call.  As it is still under warranty I won't be paying, but as I'm nearing the first full year, I guess I'll be buying the Bosch warranty plan which they have offered any number of times.  Not instilling much confidence in the product.

title: Quiet and Plenty of Room
txt:
We bought this dishwasher because our previous dishwasher  was making so much noise, it was running us out of the room.  Our Bosch dishwasher is very quiet.  If it were not for an occasional dish clanking, we would not even know it was running (except for the red light shining on the floor).
The one thing we did not expect was how much room it has.  My husband asked if I had gotten rid of some silverware because we were alway running out of clean forks.  I told him that the dishwasher seemed to hold more dishes and we were not washing as frequently.  That is a plus.  Also, I wasn't sure how much I would use the 3rd rack (top).  It is great for utensils and knives, as well as small dishes.
We have been using the 60 minute cleaning cycle.  The only time we had dishes not come out clean was when something blocked the water spinner arm.  That was our fault.  
We are happy with our purchase and would do it again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Manual needs
txt:
I think the dishwasher is great at washing, but the machine smells bad (not food smell and not food in the catcher). I called in and was told that they know about this new washer smell and that all of them smell for some reason but that this will go away eventually. 

The manual leaves a lot to be desired.  I could not get any  the various settings to work.  It was stuck on "Auto."  Nothing in manual about that.  Customer service was able to guide me how to reset it.  Seems that would be in the manual and it is not.  And, it does not tell me how to fill the Jet Dry compartment. I had to ask friends who have that option since my old machine had a small compartment that you filled each time you did a load.  Also, the salesman told me to put Pods in the area at the front of the upper tray, but there is a compartment in the door.  The manual does not say if both are acceptable or just one.  

Also, on "Air Dry" the door pops open on its own, I guess to "air dry."  I didn't know if that was normal or not.  And, once it popos open, there is what looks like a timer on the top panel and I have to hit the "off" button when I close the door. What is that all about?  Nothing in the manual about all this. Bottomline, the machine works great, but the manual needs revamped badly! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher review
txt: I recently purchased a Bosch  to replace my Viking dishwasher.  Before my purchase, I investigated several different brands. With my wife, I went to many different stores looking at each one. I considered the different options on each. Some had 3rd racks that lifted, some had drop down separators. Many had different cycles. So it came down to 3 different manufacturers. The price of all three was pretty much the same.   So what sealed the deal on Bosch?  It was NOT the salemen's opinion, but rather repairmen's opinions. Each one I talked with said in their opinon Bosch was in a class of their own. Most said they had very few repairs on Bosch dishwashers. They recommended that I purchase one if I wanted a quality product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet and pleasant device
txt:
It generally works well, the dishes get cleaned and the more or less dry while using Air Vent feature. There is a little concern with an indication of active status if a time delay is used. Basically, if we loaded the washer and scheduled it to run in 4 hours, there is no indication of that. So another person in the house might open the door to put more dishes and that resets the previous setting, so ultimately dishes don't get washed while expected.

We specifically were looking for a washer with physical pushbuttons, because a lot of modern sensor style buttons fail for our fairly ordinary fingers. This dishwasher has stellar buttons! It feels great to push it and to know that your intent is delivered to the system. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet guest in the kitchen
txt: We have never had a dishwasher as quiet as this one.  We have no wall between the kitchen and the living room and that is why we chose the Bosch dishwasher that was famous for its sound ratings.  Sure enough, we can hardly hear it running, and we can enjoy watching TV in the evening while it runs without a sound.  I also does a fabulous job of washing the dishes by the way.  The only negative I have noticed is that a few times right after we installed it, there was a problem getting it to start.  But it seems to have settled in now and hasn't been a problem lately.  One more thing worth mentioning, don't ever open the door to add one more fork or a glass or something, it does not like to restart again.  Had to turn it off and back on several times to try to get it to clear and re-start.  Quite frustrating! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Buy

title: makes dish washing a breeze.
txt: I had my new Bosch installed just before the COVID19 lockdown.  I couldn't be more pleased with it's performance!  It's quiet and does a fantastic job cleaning the dishes.  Since the stay at home was issued, my family of four has been almost using every dish in the house and our new Bosch has been full and running a couple times a week.  I wish I had got it sooner. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love the Bosch 500 Series
txt:
My wife and I had our old dishwasher go out about 18 months ago and had done our research before settling on the Bosch 500 Series based on brand reliability, user reviews and the features this dishwasher provides.  We had it installed in early March of 2020 and have been very pleased with it.  With the COVID-19 pandemic and everyone staying at home more we run the dishwasher every day and haven't had an issue or complaint.  We love the loading options the adjustable middle rack provides and the 3rd rack for silverware and long utensils, it works out great.  It is so very quiet too.  I can hardly tell it is running unlike my previous dishwasher.  The dishes dry very well, including glasses.  
The common complaints I had read were about dishes not fully drying and a bad odor from the inside of some folks dishwashers.  We use the AutoAir feature which opens the door when the cycle is complete which I find nice so that probably helps with drying.  As for any odors, we noticed a slight odor developing in the tub if we weren't good about rinsing off our silverware beforehand but if we rinse them before loading then we haven't had any issues.  
The only other thing to be aware of is the height of the dishwasher, it is a bit taller than most and as a result we had to remove a few tiles from out kitchen floor to get it to drop in under the counter but I was aware of that going in so not a big deal for me.  Overall I couldn't be happier with my purchase right now. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 500 series dishwasher
txt: Love our new Bosch.  It's very quiet, much quieter than our old one, and it does a great job cleaning the dishes, everything is spotless. The racks sections are arrnaged very logically so our dishes fit inside very well. We love the third tier rack for silverware, and that we can easily clean long stem wine glasses by lowering the middle rack. Would definitely recommend this model. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: I love the Bosch dishwasher! I had great experience with my first one I had for years and decided to get another Bosch. The three different drawers and holders/dividers are positioned wonderfully for maximum loading capacity.it is so quiet too!  I love it!!

title: Super Quiet
txt: This Bosch Dishwasher was installed in our new home a month ago and we are very happy with it.  Very quiet and the dishes come out really clean.  Quiet, looks good and it does a great job on the dishes.  What's not to like? [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher!
txt: We recently bought our Bosch dishwasher to replace our 26yo one of.another brand.  I LOVE how clean it gets our dishes, love the 3rd rack (secret rack, to quote my grandson), love that there's no visible heating coil, love how quiet it is, and I could go on and on!  The only drawback, so far, is that it takes 2 hours and 9 minutes for the Auto cycle, and even longer for special cycles.  It does a wonderful job on dishes, but takes a long time to do so.  Otherwise, I'm very pleased! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
