title: Bosch 500 Series Dishwasher
txt: We purchased this dishwasher after our 2004 GE dishwasher gave up!  It's taken a while to get used to the new one, but it's getting better each time we use it.  It really cleans the dishes well without scraping and we like the pop out door when it's finished.  The third top tray is a plus and very useful.  It came with a quick guide manual but we ended up printing 50 pages of the full manual to understand the whole operation, and a few calls to Bosch customer service.  We aren't as happy with the silverware basket and see on your website you have  several others, but not sure if they work in our model.  Also the second time we ran it with a full load, I pulled out the bottom tray to unload and two of the wheels on the right side fell off.  I guess you can order  more of those too. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet, but wish it dried better.
txt: I waited a bit after purchasing so I could really get a sense of how this dishwasher performed. I am generally happy with it. It took a while to figure out the best way to load it as it is very different inside compared to my old GE Monogram dishwasher. Wine glasses fit extremely well in the Monogram along one side on the top shelf, but to do so in the Bosch, I would have to take out the third upper shelf, which I like having. So, from now on it's wine glasses washed by hand. The Bosch is pretty quiet, which I like a lot: much more so than my old one. My biggest gripe (and I think I had read this before buying) is that, even with the dryer selection on, some items are always wet once the cycle is complete. Overall, I am glad I bought this dishwasher and hope to have it for many years to come. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

When I remove the cutlery bin, some big items fit in the space. It would be better if there was a lip of some sort to allow the larger item to lean inward slightly. Still trying to figure out how to make that space work. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt:

When it first ran it was so quiet that I started adjusting my hearing aids because I was sure I hadn't started it. The red light on my floor was the only way I knew for sure that it wason.
Only con is easy of install.  There is not much extra room to run your power and water lines. It is probably because there is so much more room inside. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good Dishwasher Poor Organization
txt: We replaced an ASKO dishwasher with this dishwasher. It cleans really well. The internal organization and layout of the dishwasher is not ideal. There isn't enough room for taller glasses on the top shelf. We have broken several when trying to close the drawer. We then have to put larger glasses in the bottom drawer but then they are in the way of the plates. I also don't think there is a lot of room to put large plates in the bottom drawer or to put bowls in the top shelf. The silverware drawer is really nice to unload and not so fun to load. It is a little slow. Also there isn't a lot of room for larger utensils like rubber spatulas or regular spatulas. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: A Dream of a Dishwasher
txt: We had to replace our three-year-old dishwasher, and we were not happy about that fact, so we did a good bit of research and settled on this Bosch.  Fossil that I am, I never knew dishwashers now came with a third drawer for utensils and plastic lids, etc.  I also wasn't aware one could buy one with a special drying cycle.  These two features, plus the excellent cleaning ability of the Bosch, have made me fall in love with my new dishwasher!  I love the fact that the silverware can be arranged by type in the handy third drawer; I put spoons, forks together, etc.  When it comes time to put them away, I'm able to grab a bunch of them by their handles and put them away in their drawer, a much more sanitary process than fishing them out of basket by the end that actually touches your food.  I didn't know I could fall in love with a kitchen appliance, but I am kind of head over heels in love with this one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Update on New Bosch
txt: We purchased this Bosch product mainly for the quality and quiet ratings. We have not been disappointed. It took a while to pick up on the way to operate the dishwasher, not sure at first if this was due to our ineptitude or some lack of clarity on the part of the instructions. FInally figured out that the door needed to be open to program the cycle. Inside the washer, we've had to get used to the knives/forks rack. A little clunky to load. Top washer doesn't seem to hold tall wine glasses, so assume all those must be loaded on the bottom. Huge capacity, and getting used to "remembering" the third "top" drawer. Deinitely as quiet as rated, and we love that aspect. A very good cleaning cycle on Auto which should handle most any load. A product we are very happy to have purchased. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dries the dishes just fine!
txt:
I needed to replace a leaking Kenmore, which had the heated dry function.  I was reluctant to purchase a Bosch because it lacked heated dry.  Almost all reviews of Bosch dishwashers were great, so it was a tough decision.  So based on scads of great reviews, and the available features, we took the plunge.

Drying is not a problem.  The air dry function works well.  A bowl with steep sides may retain a bit of water if washed on its side.  And, of course, the tops of cups often have a bit of water.  Otherwise, the dishes and glasses come out dry and sparkling.  My wife noticed the difference between the Bosch and our old Kenmore immediately.

The only thing I really don't like is the silverware basket.  I don't think our flatware is any wider than normal, but it takes some effort to seat these utensils in the basket.  I much prefer the top drawer in which you lay the flatware on its side.  This makes it much easier to remove and put away.  One reviewer suggested keeping the old Kenmore basket and using it instead.  I wish I had!  A friend bought a 
Bosch a week after we did.  We suggested they keep their old basket, and they thanked us for it.

This is a small thing.  Otherwise, an excellent dishwasher.  We're very happy with it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher ever!

It cleans perfectly and you hardly know it's running. It is so whisper quiet! Thank you Bosch! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

We live in a small home and need to run washing while watching television or entertaining and this machine is wonderful.  The triple rack is great for those of us that do not like to bend down!  The triple rack also gives us so much room on the bottom for those BIG cooking items, or our lovely plates.  Like the drying technique. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing

title: Absolutely Amazing

title: Excellent performance
txt: Extremely quiet. Dishes come out spotless with no pre rinsing. The best dishwasher I've ever owned! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: BEST PURCHASE WE'VE MADE IN A LONG TIME!
txt:
We have had our Bosch dishwasher for about a month and are now comfortable to provide a review. 

Over the years we've had a variety of different dishwashers and have had mixed results, mostly poor,  with them all. Prior issues have been included poor cleaning, staining and reliability. The dishwasher the Bosch replaced had all these issues. We did some research and Bosch seemed to be one of the highest rated in all reviews, so we decided to purchase one.

This is the absolute best dishwasher we have ever had, by far. The ease of use, being extremely quiet, the variety of cycle options and build quality put us at ease. But most importantly, it actually cleans the dishes, which in our book makes it a best buy! The dishes come out sparkling and everything we have thrown at it is handled with ease no fuss, no muss. We have actually cycled all our dishes and utensils through a wash cycle or two and just about everything comes out looking like new. 

While slightly higher priced, we are confident this will suit our needs for years to come. Well done Bosch, you have new converts! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So quiet!
txt: Glad the floor laser light was a feature...this dishwasher is so quiet you need the light to know it is running. Cleans dishes beautifully and I love that the door pops open at the end of the cycle. It really helps to dry the dishes. I also love the recessed handle on this model. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 Series dishwasher
txt: Have been using for about a month and a half. Overall performs as expected. Does require acclimating to how to load compared to our prior dishwasher (Kenmore).  Top rack is nice but wish there was a little more space (height) to accommodate bowls other than very small bowls. First time having any Bosch appliance so hopeful it will live up to its reputation. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent features, disappointing clean level
txt: I am impressed with the appearance, features, and quiet operation of the SHPM65Z55N, but it doesn't get my dishes sqeaky-clean like the 42-year-old dishwasher it replaced.  And that's using the FINISH detergent and rinse agent provided with the SHPM65Z55N.  I'm considering making a service call to see if there's some flaw in the installation or a defect in my unit.

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: So quiet!! Dishes come out clean and shiny! Love the third top rack for serving pieces and small items!

title: Great Dishwasher complicated controls
txt: Most of us like labels on buttons which states what the machine will do.  In an attempt to use a few buttons do an amazing number of things the designers have made this Bosch's controls far too complicated.  To put this criticism in perspective, I have a PhD and have taught engineering for nearly 40 years.  If you can figure out the controls, it is a great very quiet dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing Dishwasher

The top rack is great for all my cooking utensils. I also love that I can open the dishwasher if necessary even after the load has started. And finally, it opens automatically after it's completed the cycle which helps with drying.  This is a great product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love this Dishwasher!
txt: We have had this dishwasher for a few months now.  I did research on the options that I wanted and this one fit the bill.  It is so quiet!  Also, I love having the utensil rack at the very top so I can remove the rack from the bottom if needed.  The other feature I use is the "extra dry" by pushing the dry button twice.  And, this unit cleans like a dream!  I really love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Finally!!!
txt: After our recent kitchen makeover we decided to buy a Bosch dishwasher as we'd been left disappointed by past companies. We couldn't be any happier with our new dishwasher. Several key reasons for my 5 star review would be how quiet this machine is, how well it cleans and what we like to call the Grannies Attic:  the little top rack for small items and ease of use!  This dishwasher is so quiet you have to be right up on top of it to know it's on. We opted for this model as it fit perfectly in the space we had and could not use anything unless it was a flush front. I'm so glad as I was afraid that if we didn't purchase the very top of the line it might not meet our needs. Thank you Bosch!  We love our dishwasher!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Carol Starr
txt:
Love this Bosch dishwasher.
Easy to use and quiet too!

title: Clean
txt: Quiet and super clean. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I love this dishwasher!
txt:
My previous dishwasher(another brand), broke down after only 3 years, so all through the 2019 holiday season and until March I handwashed dishes for between 3 and 8 people...UGH!  I hadn't done that since being a kid with 6 siblings.  I love my new Bosch dishwasher! Not only are the dishes spit-spot clean, but you have to double check to see if it is running at all because it is SO quiet.  The first load I ran did not dry at all and I was worried that I might have to send it back, but after re-reading the manual, I tried the Auto Air cycle and things were nearly perfectly dry the next morning, but remember the door pops open so don't be alarmed.  
When COVID19 hit, I started using the Steralize setting along with the Auto Air cycle and the dishes are totally dry, however, it does take a bit longer to cycle.  Usually I set it on the Normal cycle along with the Auto Air and Steralize to save water, since at times only 3 of us are at home so the loads are lighter.  The silverware tray is a time saver when it comes to sorting silverware and makes putting silverware away a breeze.  Thank you for your fine product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So quiet
txt: We love our new dishwasher. It is so quiet. The 3rd rack for utensils is our favorite feature besides the door popping open after it is done to continue to air dry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love it Except

I struggle stacking the dishes each time I use it.  I like that the bottom shelf has prongs that can be folded down. I wish it were that way on both sides. The top doesn't quite work right either. I do a lot of shuffling around. However, If I had to choose the cleaniness over awkward shelving, I choose this. I

title: Quiet and organized
txt: Our new Bosch dishwasher is so quiet, we hardly know it's on! There's great space with our 3rd top rack for food storage lids. Highly recommend the Bosch Silence Plus 44dBA. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

It is near impossible to keep it looking clean and without fingerprints.  The cleaners I have tried so far leave an unsightly streaky finish. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My Bosch dishwasher
txt: Based on sound level, cleanliness water consumption and cacacity, I would give this unit a 5 star rating. My only problem with this unit is trying to figure out the settings. When I first got the unit it was locked into auto mode. It took me a while to figure out how to unlock it so that I could use the other modes. I am single, thus my daily dish load is light. Now that I have been able to unlock it out of auto mode, my prefered settings are, auto, half load, and open door at cycle end. I bought this unit based on its rating in Consumer Reports. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: I find the Bosch Dishwasher less than what we expected.   The diswasher is quiet and get the dishes clean .. this is what is expected primarily, however we find that it doesn't have the capacity as our prevous dishwasher.  We are running more loads.  To compensate, we have removed the utensil rack in the lower basket to add more space for larger pans and other dishes.   In addition, the door doesn't seem sturdy and robust as prevous dishwashers.  When closing it from its wide open position, it feels like its flexing.  We are also not a fan of the top controls .. the instructions were limited in how to reset it when settings are stuck on a certain setting. We had to do an internet search to find this out. It also does not make sense why the control lights are on when opening the dishwasher after completion. This does not make sense either .. the control lights should be off. We feel compelled to push the off button but this is not done everytime .. is this a problem, we simply don't know.    The red light on the floor is nice, but why didn't Bosch go ahead put a green one there to denote completion?  Seems like a logical thing to do. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I can say I have not found one type of dish, from truly baked on stuck casserole dishes to greasy grimy pots, that this dishwasher can’t handle. I honestly have only used the speed 60 cycle for all my dish needs and that works great, not sure why I need the other choices except for the half rack but I guess they are there if I ever find something I think may be a challenge!  I’m looking into othe Bosch appliances as I write this!  Thanks for lightening my load and quieting my kitchen....I can even hear the television over the dishwasher! title: My Second Bosch Dishwasher
txt: Bought another Bosch DW when I bought another home.  Was happy with the first one and like this one even more.  Have been using it for over a month now.  Love the third rack on top for spatulas, tongs, unusual items that have no other place to go in a dishwasher.  This model is very quiet, as was my first model, but this one has a much better rack loading system so I can put my soup bowls and pot lids in the rack - finally the spacing between the tines is correct for my dishes.  Couple of draw backs:  DW had a strong odor (like a chemical/oily smell) for a few weeks.  Had to leave the door open after the cycle was over for many weeks.  Also, the "Bosch" logo handle on the middle shelf keeps coming off.  Love the red glowing light on the floor showing me the DW is still running.  Prefer white appliances that do not show fingerprints and smears, but this one is Stainless to match the other appliances in this house.    Too bad it shows the dark smears, fingerprints and water marks like most Stainless appliances.  I was a little uncomfortable buying a DW that had the top of door controls, but have quickly grown to like it.  Have used the Sanitize cycle many times.  Would highly recommend this Dishwasher.  Would give this DW a 5 Star Rating, but it would have to be nearly perfect for 5 stars. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So far so good
txt: Only been a few Months all is good so far. The real test is with it make it longer than that not good LG we had before this.

title: Best dishwasher ever

txt:
3 stars because
1. I don't really like the upper pull out shelf. Personally I think it's a waste.
2. I ran my old dishwasher at night because it was loud. I run this one at night with the air dry feature so my dishes are actually dry in the morning. Otherwise they wouldn't be.
3. My old dishwasher had way more space
It does clean great and is very quiet but wish I would have kept my 22year old Kenmore.

title: First time with Bosch
txt:
had to get a new DW, so read all the reviews I could find - all said that Bosch was the #1 brand to get.  Installed ourselves in a couple of hours - no real problems there.   Unit does a really good job with cleaning, and is very quiet as expected.
I love the cutlery drawer, but find that the extra tall glasses I have no longer fit so those have to be hand washed now.   
My one real complaint is with the bottom tray design.   I am still struggling with how to arrange pots and pans in this tray.  All the prongs are angled, which is great for plates, but the pots and frying pans do not fit worth a darn.  I end up doing some hand washing which is a step backward.  So, best I can say is a 3.5 out of 5.   Everything is great other than that lower tray. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quietest Dishwasher
txt: My wife and I purchased the Bosch 500 series dishwasher last month.  It has proven to be the best dishwasher we have ever owned in the 41 years that we have been married.  The Bosch 500 does an exceptional job cleaning dishes.  It is the quietest dishwasher we have ever owned.  We love the third pull out tray at the top.  It's optional auto dry feature where the door opens after the heat drying cycle to allow for room air dry is ingenious!

title: Perfect helper during COVID-19 quarantine
txt:
We've had this dishwasher with us for just a little bit over two months and it's been great! I'm writing this review in the middle of the quarantine due to COVID-19 and we're definitel glad we have it during this time; it can hold so many more dishes than our older one that we don't have to run it every day.
This is what we think on a couple of separate points:

1. Dish cleanliness
This Bosch dishwasher leaves dishes very clean. Previously we had to rinse and scrape most of our plates, but not anymore. This saves us a good amount of time (and water) in the evenings after dinner, as we can put the dishes without rinsing (we do still scrape chunks of food, though).

2. Drying
I'd rate it about 9.5/10 in terms of how dry the dishes come out. This model doesn't have the heating element, but it has an option where the door pops open after it's done. Most dishes are dry, except for the small plastic containers that flip during the washing cycle. With a little bit of rinse aid, most dishes dry without spots.
Here we had a small issue where the door doesn't pop open everytime. About a quarter or a third of the time, the door only opens a tiny bit and the vapor condenses under our counter. This might be an issue if you have, like we do, the laminate countertops. It was covered under warranty and they're going to come and fix this whenever quarantine is over. So far, that's the only issue we've found.

3. Carrying capacity
The racks have the spacings well designed and they can hold a lot of plates, which we love. Some portions of the racks are adjustable, in case you have deeper bowls. But my favorite feature is the third rack on top. This feature may have come out a long time ago, but this is the first time we've had a dishwasher with this option and we love it. You can fit extra silverware, small lids, cooking spoons and spatulas, sippy cup lids, and a bunch of the tiny things that are too small to stay contained anywhere else.

4. Looks
Looks good. Minimalistic design with the buttons on top that can't be seen when the door is closed. I'd prefer to see the buttons, but it's OK, not a big deal.

5. Durability/Reliability
So far we've only had this for a little bit over two months, so we can't talk much about durability. If something breaks within the first couple of years I may adjust the rating to reflect that, but right now it's working, so it is still 5 stars.

TL;DR: Dishwasher is awesome. Holds a lot of dishes. Dries with pretty much no spots. Door doesn't pop all the way open all the time, but covered under warranty. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean dishes
txt: The dishes come out fantastic. I would give it 5 stars, but when I first tried to start the dishwasher, it didn't start. I looked through the manual, tried the reset button, and finally, I had to call customer service.  Customer service walked me through the steps of resetting the dishwasher. It had enough steps that I had to write it down and review it. It apparently needs a "reboot" once in awhile. Customer servie was excellent. There was no waiting time, and it was indeed 24/7 as I think I called at about 10 pm in frustration. This instruction was no where in the manual and it should be. Press "reset" for 3 seconds.When the indicator shows .01, close door, wait 1 minute. Open door. Turn off. Then turn on... starting a dishwasher should NOT be so complicated! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Huge upgrade
txt: Dumped a Whirpool for this with amazing results; cleaner dishes by simple scrape and load. Third upper rack is an excellent option. Still experimenting with placement of larger items and long stem wine glasses but they sparkle when the cycle is over.

title: Only one minor flaw
txt: Washes and dries exceptionally well. I especially like the way it opens the door a little to improve drying, which works quite well. Also of course, it is unusually quiet. As others have mentioned elsewhere, the only drawback is closely spaced tines in the dish rack. If you only use thinner plates without much of a rim, you won't have any problem but if your dishes are thicker and have a lip around the edges, the spacing is generally too close to allow good water flow and cleaning, so loading will be less efficeint than it could be. I wish there was an alternate rack available. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Diswasher
txt:
I spent quite a bit of time repairing my 8 year old LG dishwasher. When I gave up on it, I spent quite a bit of time researching the replacement before finally settling on either the BOSCH 500 or 800 Series, depending on which one I could get a better deal on. 

It ended up being the 500 and I've been very happy with it. The upgrades from the older LG are numerous - racks that move up and down, the ability to remove the silverware holder in favor of the third rack, the door opening at the end of a cycle to provide better drying, etc.. 

This would be a five star review were it not for BOSCH's own reputation. Given the reviews I read, the professionals I talked to, and the stars on this very page, I expected it to clean and dry better than any dishwasher I had ever come across. It does not. I haven't come across dishwashers that do better than this one but that old LG did an equally profecient job. Because it was a BOSCH, I was expecting to be blown away and instead I was just extremely satisfied. 

Is that worth a one star ding? I don't know, but it's my review and I can do what I want. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

The Bosch 500 series was the Wirecutter's best option, and I loved that it had a separate rack for silverware, which left more room for pots and pans on the bottom rack. I'm thrilled with it! It does a fantastic job of cleaning dirty dishes that I would never have dreamed of putting into my old washer without at least a day's worth of soaking, and it's so quiet that I sometimes have to double-check to make sure I turned it on. txt: It took me a while to get used to the dishwasher as compared to my old one which did an awesome job cleaning my dishes.  This one cleans fairly well but I have one complaint regarding the "automatic door opening".  The dishwasher should open the door immediately after the final rinse to allow the dishes to dry and evaporate the water while they are still hot. title: Aaaaahhh peace and quiet
txt: This is the quietest dish washer we have ever had AND it actually cleans the dishes AND no heat cycle - pops open to air dry. Win, win, win. Love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Washes great
txt: Washes dishes great...love the three racks...doesn't dry as good as it says it does [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 series
txt:
This is my 3rd Bosch dishwasher. I am definitely a fan of them. My dishwasher is very quiet. Many times I don't even know its running; it's so quiet. It has a top loader slide for putting lids onto which is a plus for using reusables instead of plastic baggies. 
Works well. Very quiet. Lots of storage. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet, efficient, fantastic!
txt: Stainless cavity, cleaning all my dishes is far beyond my expectations.  My two daughters and I are all proud owners of this dishwasher.  They have owned their dishwashers for 5 years and never had an issue with any parts and performance.

title: Went beyond expectations
txt:
I went with the Bosch over other brands because of the build quality.
The door hinges are much stronger, the is little or no paly or flex in the door. Once I started to use the Bosch it's cleaning capabilities and quietness went beyond my expectations. Love the air dry as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We like it; no problems with the dw so far.
txt: We have owned this dishwasher for 1 or 2 months. We like that it has no handle to poke us while we're preparing meals in front of it. We like that there is no exposed heating element in the bottom to burn the food the kids forget to rinse off and create smells inside the dishwasher (like our previous dishwasher did). We like that the filters are located front/center and are easy to remove & clean. We like that the prongs are flexible - they can be moved up or down to accommodate bowls in different locations. I like the automatic door open feature for extra drying. Cons: the same auto-door feature makes the appliance a bit harder to close - need to give a little extra pressure when closing it or it just pops open again. I turned the silverware compartment around, with the tall side inward, to make it easier to add silverware without pulling the whole bottom drawer out. We aren't used to the 3rd drawer up top and find ourselves searching for missing utensils sometimes, but we will adapt over time. We have had no problems with the new dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher
txt: Love it!  The feature I like the best is the door opens when cycle is complete,  The top rack is great for silverware,  I feel the silverware comes out better than using the basket.  The basket I have taken out as I feel it takes up a lot of space which can be better utilized. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pretty good machine

The dishwasher seems to do a nice job as long as I load the soiled dishes well. The dishwasher looks lovely in our kitchen, and I like the electronic controls hidden in the door. I've been resistant to stainless steel, but this unit doesn't show every finger print and is easy to clean. I'm a happy customer!

I love how spacious Bosch dishwashers are compared to other brands as I can adjust the different racks to add bigger loads. The only issue I had with this model is that it clogged after several weeks of usage. I scrapped the plates before loading, but food still caused the clog. However, the dishwasher began to function properly when the drain was cleared. Overall, I believe that this is a quiet, well made, efficient dishwasher. title: New 500 Series Bosch
txt: Overall, we like our new Bosch dishwasher. However, the stainless steel finish does not match our LG refrigerator, GE stove and Whirlpool microwave as well as we would like. The drying of the dishes is better with the cycle that opens the dishwasher door but we still have water at the base of coffee mugs.  The hookup to the house water was difficult.  Would appreciate a brass hose bib rather than plastic. Initial installation resulted in leakage. The plastic bib wanted to cross thread.  I would have purchased the 800 series but we wanted a recessed door handle.  Still, in terms of cleaning Bosch is the best per consumer testing. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love our Bosch Dishwasher
txt: This is our second Bosch dishwasher.  The first one was installed new in our previous home.  This one is new.  Can't beat the quality and results - dishes, pots, pans, cookware and utensils extremely clean every time.  Amazing difference when compared to our previous (Brand X) unit. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: New dishwasher
txt: This is by far the best dishwasher I have ever had. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Never thought a dishwasher was “life changing”...
txt: I realize the title sounds a bit dramatic...but I'd always just considered dishwashers all the same. They aren't! I've had high-end dishwashers from other brands but this is my first Bosch. It is better. Fantastic design...brilliant cleaning. It saves time having to prewash / rewash and has become a real timesaver in the kitchen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: A new washer leads to learning new better methods
txt: Just like getting a new car, a new dishwasher has new capabilities and features that I have learned to use and appreciate. It is really quite so I like the red light that is projected on the floor, it lets me know that it is still running or if it is flashing, I know that it needs attention. The stainless steel front panel looks good in my kitchen but I need to find out how to minimize the finger prints. The filter system in the bottom of the washer is easy to access, I just need to remember to look down there when I open the door. The design of the dish racks shows that a lot of attention was given to their usage. With my old dishwasher, I was not careful the placement of the dishes would block the water flow to and around the detergent dispensor in the door. This would result in the detergent getting wet enough to clog up but not disolve and to its job. With this dishwasher that problem has been eliminated. Another new learning experience was loading the dishes into the racks, it has three racks instead of the normal two. Nesseled into the very top is a shallow rack intended to hold the knives, forks and spoons. By paying attention as how they are arranged while loading, then aftwards putting them away is much more efficient. Sometimes, I am able to get all of the flatware in this top rack which allows me to remove the basket in the bottom rack where I used to put them. This extra space lets me get more stuff down there. All three racks have flexibility built in. The middle rack can be adjusted up and down. In addidion all three racks have even more adjustability in that some of the fingers that divide and support the items being washed are adjustable. This lets me taylor these racks to fit my dishes, pots, pans and glasses to fit my needs. And, if I remember to put in the detergent, the dishwasher does get all that stuff clean. Another capability is that I can have it open the door a bit when it is finished. This does two things, it allows the air to circulate helping to finish drying the contents and I can see at a distance that it has finished the load. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great appliance
txt: We are impressed by the quiet operation and the design of the interior.  It holds more dishes than we have.  We run it when we are out of silverware.  It also looks great and is easy to clean the stainless exterior.  All positive with Bosch products. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: More tech assistance for the technology challenged
txt: The biggest complaint I have is that the guides included with my dishwasher were totally inadequate to answer many of my questions regarding the simple use of the machine.  Finally, I resorted to on-line manual which was able to explain things, especially the appearance of the green light on the floor, as well as, how to set the various programming functions.  There was not a single reference to the green light, itself.  I am sorry, but there was woefully inadequate guidance with the manuals.  Telephone assistance was great to explain why the dishwasher was not able to be started initially with a blinking green light. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The horrors of co-workers convinced me to buy it.
txt: This dishwasher is handling food and pumping out dry dishes. Very impressed. Switched to Bosch because at my office we have 4 Bosch's. Each of which run multiple loads a day. And these aren't normal loads of dirty dishes. They are filled with the most disgusting of communcal dishwasher etiqueite. Entire plates covered in peanut butter, bowls with microwave baked on soup residue. Cups with that nasty coffee gunk in the bottom becaue they sat at a desk for two weeks. You wouldn't believe what people put in them. Not to mention absolutely zero attention to proper loading instructions. Things are just everywhere. I figured if it can handle that co-worker chaos, then it will certinaly take care of a normal family volume with even a nod to loading it in a way that any decent human would. Highly recommend. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

After researching dishwashers we decided on the Bosch because CLEANING the dishes was the area in which it excelled, according to the test kitchens.  They were not wrong!  We love this dishwasher!  Everything is squeaky clean.  We also like the racks...especially the top rack for silverware.  Even our wine glasses come out crystal clear.  Thank you!! txt: This is our second one, I do like some of the qualities on this one - 1) red light on the floor so you know the dishwasher is on or off. 2) 3rd upper rack 3) Very quite. So I can put bigger dinner plates in?  And, only 2 of us here, so we only run it every 2nd or 3rd day so the smell of dirty dishes (and we rinse ours) leaves a stuffing smell until you do a load. This works OK but doesn't dry completely [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

The dishwasher is so quiet when it is running- I look for the light under the door to know that it is running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Generally great
txt: Works well & is very quiet. Sometimes small amounts of our biodegradable powdered detergent is left on items in the top drawer. We feel strongly that using products that are healthy for us and the earth, instead of toxic chlorine, etc,. is important. So we just rinse off the small deposits. We also use biodegradable rinse agent, again w/o toxic ingredients. The dishwasher could do better on items like glass and metal pans with encrusted food. But generally it cleans very well. We know Bosch, according to Consumer Reports, is very reliable, and we picked it for that as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher on the market

title: Wow!
txt: This is one quiet dishwasher.  It cleans dishes sparkling clean and pops open after completing the cycle, if you want to it too do so. This helps the dishes air dry any residual moisture. The racks have various adjustments that allow the appliance to be loaded in numerous configurations. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: Very quiet and cleans the dishes so well! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So disappointed
txt: I could cry......  I did research on dishwashers before I decided on this one.  Even talked to very nice person at Bosch who talked to me about the drying situation.  I thought this “open door” thing would be okay.  It is not!  I have had the dw for less than two weeks.......and I hate not having dry dishes!  I want to put glasses and cups and pots straight from dw to shelf and that cannot happen.    After even two days of the open door, cups still have water on the bottom and pots have water inside.  Can’t put wet cups on shelf, etc.  I now have a drying rack on counter to place dishes to dry....  The door pops open so far that it protrudes into my galley kitchen.  Can’t shut it because of the moisture inside; dishes would NEVER dry.  It does clean well and noise level is okay, but I do not want to live with this for several years.....

title: I'm in love!
txt:
After many years of washing dishes by hand, my husband picked out what he said was the best dishwasher and said let's enter the 21st century. So I agreed. I left it in his hands and trusted what he said was going to be the best. I will say that I read the operation manual, and I have done everything "right" with cleaning once per month and using rinse aid. 
I have only ever used the Auto cycle with the Auto air dry option, and I have only had one negative experience (more on that in a moment).
When I first got the dishwasher, I wanted to "help" it by making sure my dishes were completely rinsed of debris before I loaded them; they came out clean.
As the weeks have gone by, I have loaded without rinsing, minus any large pieces of debris on the plates and the dishes continue to come out SO CLEAN.
I typically run the washer overnight, it pops open to air dry, and by the time I am home from work the next day, the dishes are completely dry to be put away, minus any awkward angles that I didnt realize...aka the indented bottom of my coffee mugs may still have water sitting on top; as long as you unload from the bottom drawer up, you won't risk spilling any water on dry dishes.
Moving on: the only slightly disappointing thing I have to say about this dishwasher is that no matter where I place my re-usable tupperwares, the wash is SO POWERFUL that they are blown around and usually full of water by the end of the cycle...I have even jammed them into spots where I thought there was no way they could move...they did. Furthermore, even using the recommended pods and jet dry liquid, the typical white residue was left on the tupperware here and there. SOLUTION: I hand-wash my tupperware. It's a small price to pay for the great job on the rest of the dishes, and there's no reason to take a star away for that. 
I've never used the moveable rack feature...I've never had anything to wash so tall that I needed to do that. 
Love the top rack for washing measuring cups and utelsils, because few of mine will actually fit in the silverware holder...but they always do in the top rack.
Lastly, the only negative experience aforementioned, was because I shut the dishwasher after it had popped open (before I left for work one morning) and didn't allow the dishes to dry properly. When I re-opened, they were covered in a light mist from all the moisture that had collected while the door was shut, and everything just seemed eww, so I ran the washer again. Moral of the story: let it do its thing! Don't complain about having wet dishes because you didn't give them long enough to air dry! Or, use a towl to finish drying them. It's not an inconvenience if you TRULY want sparkling clean dishes every single time! I'm very happy with this purchase! If you absolutely MUST have dry dishes and the long air dry is an inconveinence, buy something else! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Awful
txt: If I wanted a dishwasher that left food all over my dishes, I would've kept the half broken one we recycled. We spent more money then usual so we could have a high quality appliance. What a sore disappointment this thing proved to be. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Regular Dishwasher User
txt: Had Bosch a couple of times about 10 years ago. Then we tried using Samsung but that didn't work out very well due to defects. Switched back to Bosch. Although it didn't have other bells and whistles that I found in Samsung, this one is more reliable and defect free. It's super quiet and love the option of opening automatically at the end of the cycle. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Is a QUIET machine
txt: The Bosch 500 is a very nice machine, well designed to use space and is very quiet. I found that it took a little effort to figure out how to best use the machine settings for excellent results, but after 4-5 experiments I found the best way to achieve clean dry dishes with the evaporative drying method. That proved to be fine once I routinely set the door to open at the end of the cleaning cycle. Otherwise, dishes were regularly damp. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: love this dishwasher
txt: I've owned alot of dishwashers in the last 30 years, and this is by far the best one I've ever had. First, it is so quiet I hardly know it is running. I love that it has a feature that will pop the door open if I want it to air dry after the wash cycle is finished. I love that it has a top rack for big spoons and other types of big flatware or lids. The middle shelf is also adjustable up and down which is a nice feature if you need to wash a tall item like long stemmed wine glasses. But the most important thing of course is that the dishes come out sparkling clean. I've had it for over a month, and I run it at least once a day, and I have yet to see any dish that needs to be rewashed or hand washed because it didn't get clean. I would recommend this to anyone. So happy with it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Replacement for 12YO Miele - goes VERY Well!
txt:
I am really happy with this appliance! Like my title indicates, this was a replacement for an older Miele (which had served us well) but all of the great reviews on this product (and the cost compared to Miele) sent me in the direction of this unit. The Bosch exceeded all of my expectations; It cleaned and dried very well, the height adjustment for the upper shelf was an ingenious solution to a “tall glass” issue, and the silverware drawer (at the top of the unit) is a new spin on the concept for us as it works very well, is really convenient for load/unload, and we put the bottom shelf silverware baskets in a closet and now enjoy the increased real estate in the bottom shelf. The unit is dead quiet during operation and the projected (red) light on the floor is great for active cycle indication.

My only criticism (which I got used to quickly) was setting the elevation of the unit (as to not leave too large of a gap between the top of the unit and the bottom of the counter) meant that you need to open the door to set the cycle parameters and press the “start cycle” button then you need to close the door to start the cycle – not a huge problem but different than expectations. Also, if you push too many buttons when starting a cycle you can’t make any changes until you hold the “start’” button down for 5 seconds. This wasn’t documented anywhere so it took a little while to figure out. Finally there’s a few programming options (like jet dry strength, enabling/disabling Auto-air door opening) that you need to use the programing instructions, it’s not hard, but the manual is not great and it takes a little practice.]

Beyond that I stand enthusiastically behind my 5-stars! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love It
txt:
We replaced an expensive, 5 year old diswasher from another manufacturer with this one. They looked very similar on the outside, but the difference in performance is astonishing. 

We were seriously considering getting new dishes because food was always glued to our plates after the cycle completed on the old dishwasher. We really thought it was our dishes. 

When the old dishwasher's pump went out, we decided not to fix it and just get a new dishwasher. So happy we did. This thing leaves our dishes spotless and our glassware is sparkling. We use generic liquid detergent and no rinse aid. When I think of all the time we spent hand-scrubbing dishes with our old dishwasher, it makes me so mad. Thanks BOSCH!  My main complaints are the top rack is a little high up so taller glasses won't fitand I wish the dishes would be a bit dryer at the end of the cycle. The final complaint is this dish washer wants you to add rinse aid which is no problem however it seems to use a large amount of it because when purchased, it came with a 23 load supply and I added more and with in about 10 loads the red light is on saying it needs more.

Other than that this dishwasher is doing great and I will update if something happens in under a year or so. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: For the money, not worth it. We purchased a Samsung dishwasher from Home Depo 3 years ago with a ...
txt:
For the money, not worth it. We purchased a Samsung dishwasher from Home Depo 3 years ago with a stove and a fridge together only to end up highly disappointed in the products. We spend a mint on them. Not cheap! The dishwasher was around $420 and ended up being the worst, lasting only about 3 years and becoming a fire hazard. I made the mistake of letting it get past warranty so we cut our losses, got rid of the fire hazard Samsung garbage dish washer and returned to Home Depo to shop for something better. We went for broke this time and purchased the Bosch. We where told was the BEST of the best and would be happy with the results. Well, .... I may never buy another appliance from Home Depo again. Where do I begin. 
1.) The door opens very stiff. Not easy to open and close
2.) The bottom rack is defective. The wheels on the bottom rack do NOT alien right with the lip on the inside of the tub. So the rack doesn't slide in and out easily the way it should, it falls to the right and the left and crooked inside the tub. I have to pick up the whole rack and place it on the door to get it out every single time I use it. The rack doesn't slide in the right way unless I pick it up and place it in on the track otherwise it falls off on top of the rotating spray jet, preventing the washer water from reaching the dishes and doing its job well. The bottom rack design, wheels and interior tub is a total fail!!! For a grand, I would have expected a much more user friendly dishwasher. After all, for the amount of time I spent fighting with the bottom rack, I probably could have just saved my back and washed everything myself in the sink. Don't buy this piece of crap!

title: Wonderful dishwasher!
txt: We bought this to replace a 20 year old dishwasher that came with our house and what a difference. The Bosch is quieter, much more spacious and is laid out in a way that gives lots of flexibility for loading it.  Most important our dishes are cleaner and with red indicator light, we know when the cycle is done.  Highly recommend to anyone in the market for a new dishwasher.

title: Auto-air feature

The loading configuration takes a bit of time to work out, however. I couldn't be happier. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This is a great product! We installed it ourselves to...
txt: This is a great product! We installed it ourselves to replace our year old Frigidaire gallery dishwasher. We had a Bosch at our old house and had to get a new one. It’s silent when washing the dishes and the auto-air feature is great!

title: Quiet as advertised Gets dishes cleanBut! Does not dry the...
txt: Quiet as advertised Gets dishes cleanBut! Does not dry the dishes and there is always water in the bottom

title: Purchased this dishwasher and had it installed in 10/2019. Home Depot charged us $150 for install...
txt:
Purchased this dishwasher and had it installed in 10/2019. Home Depot charged us $150 for installation, then when their subcontractor came to install the dishwasher, they charged us an additional $310. $460 for installation seems excessive to me, since we already had a KitchenAid dishwasher that was being replaced, and was operational. 

Like most other reviewers have reported, it operates very quietly, and projects a red light onto the floor while working. I've been using the automatic setting for washing the dishes, always use the recommended drying/spotting solution in addition to cleaning tablets. Does a good job cleaning dishes, cups, glasses, flatware. Doesn't do as good a job drying as my previous KitchenAid which I had for almost 20 years. Lowest rack dishes, dry fine. Flatware, I end up having to dry by hand, mugs and cups, divots in bottoms don't dry out even if left to dry all day or over night. I guess this is the best we can expect with the "energy efficient models." 

The design of the upper rack that holds cups glasses includes one very thin row that doesn't really hold my glasses or cups, so is more of a wasted area and to use it for small glasses they have to hang over the spindles, rather than between as is recommended. I use the uppermost rack for cooking utensils and small souffle cups, but it usually only contains a few things. My biggest concern is the latch, which seems a bit feeble. We leave dishes in the sink more often now, so that we don't have to constantly open/close the dishwasher

Again, my biggest issue is the excessive cost of installation.

title: Super quiet.
txt: Works very well and is super quiet.

title: Did everything ir said. Except still lraves water on plastics....
txt: Did everything ir said. Except still lraves water on plastics.

title: Happy Owner

txt: Dishwasher is super quiet.  Looks great. Cleans dishes very well.  Energy efficient.  I’m not entirely sold on the racking system, I haven’t quite figured out how to get everything in there.

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: The product is as described service was awesome and will shop as Home Depot again

title: Cleans well
txt: This dishwasher cleans well. On the other hand, I do not care for the way you have to place your dishes in the dishwasher.  It's setup for more plates than pots and pans. I would not buy for a large family.

title: Not crazy about my new dishwasher
txt: I've always bought Bosch but this one is too hi-tech.  I've had to call twice on how to get a Quick Wash but it always reverts to a wash for 2.25 hours.   I will say the dishes are really clean but also wet. I have to leave the door ajar for some time so they can dry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We upgraded from a 13 year old stainless steel Bosch dishwasher (still running great) to this mod...
txt:
We upgraded from a 13 year old stainless steel Bosch dishwasher (still running great) to this model in early 2020.  And what a terrific upgrade it has been.  We love the space utilization 3 drawers affords us.  Each of the drawers can be adjusted to a certain degree most notably, the middle drawer which can be raised or lowered to account for height differences of the items you're washing.  This unit is extremely quiet and we love that it provides a time estimate for how long the cycle will take, even providing a 1 hour speed wash if you're in a hurry.  

But our favorite feature has to be the auto-open feature.  We run our dishwasher almost every night right after cleaning up the kitchen.  With the auto-open the dishes are completely dry save for a coffee mug or two which may have a recessed base which collected some water.  This feature is so clever and helpful.  

If our previous Bosch dishwasher is any indication (again, it was still running great when we decided to replace it), we look forward to many many years of great service from this model.

title: So Quiet and Spacious!
txt: This dishwasher is by far the quietest dishwasher I have ever owned. It works very well and dishes come out squeaky clean, there's also SO much room in the washer. One tip is to use the Finish drying detergent with it because otherwise, dishes come out a little more wet than usual. It also helps lower the humidity after the wash. No, I do not work for Finish detergents. Overall, a great purchase! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Soaked!
txt: Dishwasher does not dry dishes at all. If you don't mind drying your dishes before putting them away then this is for you. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great machine
txt: My new washing machine is super quiet and does a great job on the dishes. My only problem was with the delivery process. It took 4 tries before the delivered an undamaged machine within the allowed delivery window at my condo.

title: 500 Series dishwasher
txt: My dishwasher wouldnt work when I plugged it in. I wrote a bad review. I rechecked the wiring to the outlet and there was a loose neutral wire. I recant my previous review and am embarassed to find an electrical wiring problem. Everything is great on its first wash.

title: NOT AS GOOD AS MY BOTTOM OF THE LINE MIELE
txt: The good comments first--this dishwasher is very quiet, washes the silverware good and I like the top rack.  Unhappy with the wash results.  Things that would have come clean in my old dishwasher don't come clean in this one.  Also it smells between washes even though I rinse the dishes, can't imagine how bad it would smell if I followed the directions and didn't rinse.  Plus it smells musty after it washes.  I have to leave it open to avoid the smell.  Not what I expected. Don't think it was a good value for the money.  Looks like I'm stuck now. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 500 SERIES DISHWASHER
txt:
PLUGGED IT IN........NOTHING......CALLED BOSCH........LOOKING FOR SOMEONE TO COME OUT AAND LOOK AT IT. SAID SOMEONE WILL TRY TO CONTACT ME IN 24 HOURS. MY WIFE IS IN THE KITCHEN WASHING DISHES. I AM NEXT!
POWER TO THE PLUG AND POWER TO THE END OF THE PLUG.

title: Works great. Looks great. It’s truly a Bosch!!
txt: Best dishwasher I've ever had. Extremely quiet. Washes my dishes very clean.  I can tell a lot of thought and engineering went into this dishwasher. Keep up the good work Bosch [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Solid Diswasher
txt: This is the third Bosch dishwasher we've owned. We've always particularly appreciated how every one has both been quiet, and cleans the dishes even when stuffed to the gills with a large load (a daily occurrence with our family of 5). On this model, we appreciate the flexibility of the third silverware rack (we're able to fit even more in), and the way it pops open to air dry at the end, since we usually run it overnight. Opportunities for improvement: we didn't realize that by getting a model with a third rack, we'd lose the ability to fit 1/2 sheet pans in the bottom rack- there's just not enough vertical space. That's meant a lot more hand washing for us. We also miss having two separate silverware baskets, so if we need it, we don't have to take up the whole side of the bottom rack.

title: Dishwasher
txt: Love my dishwasher.   Cleans amazingly without prerinseing. Love the feature of the door opening by itself when set. Load before bed and in morning everything is clean and dry. Will never purchase any other dishwasher than Bosch. Salesman was the greatest as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Tarnishing flatware
txt: We are very unhappy that the eating utensils (knives, forks and spoons) we put in the dishwasher tarnish the finish, which looks like white powder finish instead of the original shiny finish.  I just spent an hour polishing the utensils and so can no longer use the utensils we have been using.  We have had to buy cheap stainless steel utensils, which makes us very dissatisfied.  We use Cascade with Oxiclean and the label says it gives a brilliant finish, which is not true.  I won't recommend your product to anyone that asks me about it.

title: Bosch 500 Series Dishwasher
txt: I am not as happy with my dishwasher as I had hoped.  It functions just fine, but I have such a hard time loading it.  I know that the reason the bottom basket is lower is to allow for more dishes and for the upper rack, but that in combination with the extreme slant of the tines makes it much harder to load bowls and plates.  I wish I had spent a little more time looking at the racks and determining what would be a good fit for what I had been used to with my Whirlpool that lasted 23 years. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 500 Series Washer
txt: Very quiet with a nice interior layout for dishes and silverware. The drain line was a bit short so I had to splice in the drain line from our old dishwasher to connect to our disposal drain port. One fairly big disappointment; the from leveling "feet." The front leveling was not easy, the "feet" and all of the leveling screws are plastic. To adjust the leveling screws you have to turn them by inserting a screwdiver into the petal-like feet. This is very difficult and the feet get damaged until you can get an 18mm wrench on the nut-like feature just above the feet. I found this difficult and not what your would expect from a higher-end dishwasher.

My wife and I both love the dish washer. Very, very quite. Cleans like a power washer. Pops open once the dishes are done. Can not say anything bad at this time. We have been running for three plus months. We installed ourselves. Very easy to do if you a handy at all. Will keep buying Bosch dishwasher. Happy Customer. title: Super Quiet Working Machine
txt:
This is the second appliance I have purchased from Bosch, it will not be my last.

The 500 Series Bosch dishwasher I own is the best; not only for the quiet (barely can hear the inner workings) but for the way my dishes come out "squeaky" clean.  The upper tray on this model is a bonus for flatware or cooking utensil, with an adjustable second self for larger items and the third shelf large and deep enough to hold most dishes or pots and pans, sometimes both.

I am very satisfied with my new Bosch 500 series dishwasher. Would I the recommend the series to a friend, you better believe I would and will; not only to friends but strangers as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quality and Quiet
txt: This dishwasher is great! It is really quite and I love having the 3rd rack. I use it often. It takes time to get used to how to load it for maximum usage. The one drawback I found was it doesn't come with a manual, so if you want to know how to operate all it's functions, you need to go online. I would have preferred a book. I work on a computer 8-10 hours a day and don't really feel like getting on one when I get home. When we have called customer service, they have always been very helpful. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Works as promised - excellent!...
txt: Works as promised - excellent!

title: LOVE THIS DISHWASHER
txt: While this is a quite recent purchase, so I can't make a long-term review, this is the third dishwasher I have owned and is by far the best. It is the quietest and easiest to load for sure! I hope to have it for many years to come. We were willing to pay a little more than some brands to get an American made product. Having had 2 appliances that needed warranty work with another brand, and having to wait weeks and even MONTHS to get the parts and service work done, we narrowed our search down to Bosch and I believe we will not regret that decision, [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosh 500 Dishwasher
txt: Awesome product and so quiet (44 db) that there is a red light that refects on the floor to let you know this dishwasher is running. The shelf options are awesome, plus and extra third shelf on top. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Smells awful (did good job)
txt:
I am saddened to say that though the dishwasher did a wonderful job cleaning the dishes, the resulting awful smell in it upon completion was nauseating.  Unfortunately when I told the seller about the issue, she encouraged me to get another brand as a replacement. Now, I have a DIFFERENT brand, which I less prefer regarding loading and capacity that ALSO has an AWFUL smell upon cycle completion. I have had dishwashers for almost 50 years, and this is the first time I have had this issue.  The bad odor problem is confirmed by my husband. From what we now read, it seems that new water, and power conservation efforts have caused this unfortunate situation. I have only used the replacement d/w once.  The Bosch I had used approximately 4 times (had to wait for the replacement machine to be ordered,and arrive). Both d/w were installed by the plumber via the Big Box store from which purchased. Now we have to figure out how to avoid the BAD ODOR issue in a machine that I less prefer, but do intend to talk to management at the Big Box store.  I am now trying the Hi-Temp option to see if that will help (no plastics) . Also will contact mfg of new machine for advice.
Both models were at the upper price range of those offered at the store.
I recommend that NO NEW DISHWASHERS be purchased without taking this unfortnate issue into consideration. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt:
This is my 2nd one at my new house.
The 1st one worked great for more than 10 years with no problem [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: State of the Art Dish Washer
txt: Bosch has incorporated the latest electronic technology with innovative design to produce the finest machine on the market.  I did not think that my 15 year old Bosch could be improved upon, but they did....greater capacity, near silent when operating, amazing design features including innovative racks, divergent dispensers, and controls.  All told a vastly superior machine! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Lovely!
txt: I love this dishwasher.  It's huge on the inside, cleans well, and is nice to operate.  My biggest complaints are that the items on the third shelf don't get very clean.  That is more for stuff that isn't very dirty.  The other "complaint" really isn't, but it's SO quite that more than a few times someone in my house opens the door and gets water all over.  There is a light on the floor to tell you it's on so it just takes people paying attention. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Satisfied customer
txt: We recently replaced our 12 year old Frigidaire Galaxy dishwasher with a new Bosch 500 Series Silence Plus. It runs so quietly and is such a dramatically improved appliance to our old one! I would recommend no other dishwasher than a Bosch! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great
txt: Works as advertized! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: When our 4 year old Jenn-Air that came with the...
txt: When our 4 year old Jenn-Air that came with the condo ceased to be able to actually clean the dishes and silverware, I found that the Bosch 500 series received universally top reviews. We are not disappointed so far. It accommodates a lot of dishes, bowls, and cups and cleans and dries very well.

title: As good as ot gets!
txt: The product was delivered and installed on time by great people.  A very good start, and the performance of the dishwasher has met or exceeded our expectations.  We especially like the "auto air" option and never have any issues with dihes that aren;t quite dry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Almost Perfect
txt:
I really wanted to out 4.5, but here's how I'd rank it in individual categories.

For cleaning dishes, five stars. It does an amazing job. Even for baked on food, I was truly shocked by how spotless it cleaned a casserole dish that had some serious baked on residue.

For fit and finish, five stars. Love the detailed thought that went into designing it. The third rack is great for putting utensils and other small items on,  which opens up space in the other two racks. Several adjustable features also make for quick and easy options for loading and securing dishes. 

For ease of installation and noise, five stars. I installed it myself and the instructions were easy to follow. It's very quite too. You really don't hear it running. The red light that is visible on the floor when running is a nice feature to let you know that it is.

For drying, four stars. This model has the auto air feature which I liked since it automatically opens the dishwasher after completing its cycle to allow for further drying of the dishes. Despite this feature, and even after 8 - 9 hours later, there are still some dishes that are not completely dry. Especially, tupperware. Most everything else is dry. 

Overall, super happy with our purchase of this Bosch dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My Bosch dishwasher
txt: I didn't know dishwashers could clean dishes without basically cleaning them first. I would recommend the Bosch dishwasher to anyone. I love the fact that the door opens to let the steam out after the cycle ends. My window plants love it too. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher ever!
txt: We could not be happier with this dishwasher purchase. After ever cycle all the dishes come out sparkling clean and the Auto Air feature is great at making sure the dishes are fully dry. The third-rack is also a life-saver since we can get in extra dishes. This was also a major upgrade over our last dishwasher since we could not be downstairs when we ran it and now we can't even hear it when it is running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 500 Dishwasher
txt: Absolute best that we have ever owned. Cleans and dries with perfection.

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: Very quiet, cleans great, great buy!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher
txt: I am extremely satisfied with this dishwasher I've been through several different brands and would highly recommend this one most of all my wife likes it, Happy wife happy life [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It's so quiet!!
txt: I love my new dishwasher! It's so quiet I can hardly tell it's even on! Cleans and dries the dishes beautifully. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pretty nice, quiet, need to push too many buttons
txt: So far, so good. Overall we're very happy with our new dishwasher, especially how quiet it is, which was one of our major issues with our last one. However, the design of the control software requires more button pushes than it should. For example, when the machine is all done with it's cycle, and notifies you, if you open the door and then close it again, it will alarm. You need to push the OFF button, even though it was already off. It's annoying and makes one wonder if anyone ever tried it. The same thing goes for when you want to start a new wash cycle. You have to hit the ON button, then select your desired wash cycle button, and then hit the start button. That's one button too many! (And as an engineer, I have to say that the buttons have a very unsatisfying feel - not a nice crisp click. You can feel the PC board behind the panel flex a bit when you hit a button.)

title: Unhappy
txt: I wish Bosch would let potential buyers that this dishwasher won't dry your dishes. Not happy at all because I always have to towel dry the dishes.
